div1.head: Ὑάδες
div1.sense: the Hyades, seven stars in the head of the bull, which threatened rain when they rose with the sun, Il., Hes.
div1.etym: Commonly deriv. from ὕω, cf. Lat. Pluviae: but the genuine Lat. name was suculae, piglings, as if ὗς were the root; and this agrees with the quantity, υ being short in ὑάδες, long in ὕω: Eur. however has ὑάδες with ῡ.

div1.head: ὕαινα
div1.sense: the hyaena, an animal of the dog kind, with a bristly mane like a hog (whence the name), Hdt.

div1.head: Ὑακίνθια
div1.sense: (sc. ἱερά), τά, a Lacedaemonian festival in honour of Hyacinthus, held in the month Hecatombaeon, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ὑακινθινοβαφής
div1.sense: dyed hyacinth-colour, Xen.

div1.head: ὑακίνθινος
div1.sense: hyacinthine, Od., Eur.

div1.head: ὑάκινθος
div1.sense: the hyacinth, Il., etc.;—a flower said to have sprung up from the blood of Hyacinthus or of Ajax; and the petals were thought to bear the letters αἰ, or αἰαι, Mosch.; hence the epithet γραπτά in Theocr. The hyacinth seems to have comprehended several dark blue flowers: Hom. speaks of dark hair as ὑακινθίνῳ ἄνθει ὁμοῖαι, and Theocr. calls it black.
a precious stone, of blue colour, not (prob.) our jacinth, but the sapphire, NTest.

div1.head: Ὑάκινθος
div1.sense: Hyacinthus, a Laconian youth, beloved by Apollo, who killed him by a cast of the discus, Eur.

div1.head: ὑάλεος
div1.sense: of glass, Anth.: —contr. ὑαλοῦς, ᾶ, οῦν, of glass, Strab., Luc.

div1.head: ὑάλινος
div1.sense: of crystal or glass, Ar.: also ὑέλινος, η, ον, Anth.

div1.head: ὕαλος
div1.sense: a clear, transparent stone, used by the Egyptians to enclose their mummies in, oriental alabaster, Hdt.
a convex lens of crystal, used as a burning-glass, Ar.
glass, Lat. vitrum, Plat.: glass itself existed in the time of Hdt., but was not called ὕαλος till Platoʼs time.
div1.etym: The word is said to be Egyptian. Others refer it to ὕω, as if the orig. sense were raindrop.

div1.head: ὑαλόχρους
div1.sense: glass-coloured, Anth.

div1.head: ὑβός
div1.sense: hump-backed, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑβρίζω
div1.sense: to wax wanton, run riot, Od., Aesch., etc.; opp. to σωφρονεῖν, Xen.
of over-fed horses or asses, to neigh or bray and prance about, Lat. lascivire, Hdt., Xen.
metaph. of a rapid rushing river, Hdt.

in dealing with other persons, ὑβρ. τινά to treat him despitefully, to outrage, insult, affront, maltreat, Il., Aesch.; more commonly, ὑβρ. εἴς τινα to commit an outrage upon or towards him, Eur., Plat.; ὑβρ. ἐπί τινα to exult over a fallen foe, Eur.

c. acc. cogn., ὑβρ. ὕβριν Aesch., Eur., etc.: —with a neut. adj., ὑβρ. τάδε to commit these outrages, Hdt.; so, τῶν ἀδικημάτων τῶν ἐς Ἀθηναίους ὕβρισαν Hdt.; and with double acc., ὕβριν ὑβρίζειν τινά Eur.:— hence in Pass., ὕβριν ὑβρισθῆναι Eur., Dem.

at Athens in legal sense, to do one a personal outrage, to maltreat, assault, Oratt.:—Pass., γυναῖκες καὶ παῖδες ὑβρίζονται Thuc.; ὑβριζόμενος ἀποθνήσκει he dies of ill-treatment, Xen.;—and of acts, τὰ ὑβρισμένα outrages, Lys.
perf. pass. part., of things, arrogant, ostentatious, σημεῖʼ ἔχων ὑβρισμένα Eur.; στολὴ ὑβρισμένη Xen.

div1.head: ὕβρισμα
div1.sense: a wanton or insolent act, an outrage, Hdt., Eur., etc.; τόδʼ ὕβρισμʼ ἐς ἡμᾶς ἠξίωσεν ὑβρίσαι Eur., Xen.; τὰ τούτων ὑβρίσματα εἰς ἐμέ Dem.
an object of insolence, ὕβρισμα θέσθαι τινά ὑβρίζειν, Eur.
= ὑβριστής, Eur.

div1.head: ὕβρις
div1.sense: wantonness, wanton violence or insolence, Od., Hdt., etc.; of actions, ἆρʼ οὐχ ὕβρις τάδʼ; Soph.; ταῦτʼ οὐχ ὕβρις ἐστί; Ar.:—adv. usages, ὕβρει in wantonness or insolence, Soph.; ἐφʼ ὕβρει Eur.; διʼ ὕβριν Dem.
of lewdness, opp. to σωφροσύνη. Theogn., Xen.
of over-fed horses, riotousness, restiveness, Hdt., Pind.

= ὕβρισμα, Hom.; sometimes like ὑβρίζω, foll. by a prep., Ἥρας μητέρʼ εἰς ἐμὴν ὕβρις her outrage towards . . , Eur.; ἡ κατʼ Ἀργείους ὕ. Soph.; ἡ πρὸς τοὺς δημότας ὕ. Hdt.; also c. gen. objecti, ὕ. τινός towards him, Hdt., etc.:—in pl. wanton acts, outrages, Hes., Eur., etc.
an outrage on the person, violation, Pind., Attic

in Attic law, ὕβρις comprehended all the more serious injuries done to the person, grievous assault, the slighter kind being αἰκία [ῑ]: hence ὕβρις was remedied by public indictment (γραφή), αἰκία by private action (δίκη).
a loss, damage, NTest.
as masc. = ὑβριστής, a violent, overbearing man, ὕβριν ἀνέρα Hes.

div1.head: ὑβριστέος
div1.sense: that may be insulted, Dem.

div1.head: ὑβριστής
div1.sense: a violent, overbearing person, a wanton, insolent man, Hom., Hdt., Attic
opp. to σώφρων, lustful, lewd, Ar., Xen.
of animals, wanton, restive, unruly, Eur., Xen.
of natural forces, ὑβριστὴς ἄνεμος Hes.; ὑβριστὴς ποταμός Aesch.

div1.head: ὑβριστικός
div1.sense: given to wantonness, wanton, insolent, outrageous, Plat., etc.:— τὸ ὑβριστικόν an insolent disposition, Xen.:—adv. -κῶς, Plat.; comp. -ώτερον, Dem.

div1.head: ὕβριστος
div1.sense: wanton, insolent, outrageous: — hence comp. ὑβριστότερος, Hdt., Xen.; Sup. ὑβριστότατος, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ὑγιάζω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to become healthy, get well, Arist.

div1.head: ὑγιαίνω
div1.sense: to be sound, healthy or in health, Lat. bene valere, Hdt., Ar., etc.
to be sound of mind, Theogn., Ar., etc.; τὰς φρένας ὑγ. Hdt.
of soundness in political or religious opinion, τὸ ὑγιαῖνον τῆς Ἑλλάδος Hdt.

div1.head: ὑγιαίνω
div1.sense: to be sound, healthy or in health, Lat. bene valere, Hdt., Ar., etc.
to be sound of mind, Theogn., Ar., etc.; τὰς φρένας ὑγ. Hdt.
of soundness in political or religious opinion, τὸ ὑγιαῖνον τῆς Ἑλλάδος Hdt.

div1.head: ὑγίεια
div1.sense: health, soundness of body, Lat. salus, Hdt., Attic:—pl. ὑγίειαι, healthy states or conditions, Plat.
of the mind, ὑ. φρενῶν soundness of mind, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑγιεινός
div1.sense: good for the health, wholesome, sound, healthy, Xen., etc.
of persons, healthy, sound, Lat. sanus, Plat.; τὸ ὑγ. health, Arist.
adv., ὑγιεινῶς ἔχειν, ὑγιαίνειν, Plat.: —comp. ὑγιεινοτέρως and -ρον, Sup. -ότατα, Xen.

div1.head: ὑγιηρός
div1.sense: good for the health, wholesome, Pind.
of persons, healthy, hearty, sound, Lat. sanus, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑγιής
div1.sense: comp. and Sup. ὑγιέστερος, -ατος:— sound, healthy, hearty, sound in body, Lat. sanus, ὑγιέα ἀποδέξαι or ποιεῖν τινα to restore him to health, make him sound, Hdt.; ὑγιὴς τὸ δῆγμα cured of the bite, Xen.
of condition, σῶς καὶ ὑγιής safe and sound, in good case, Hdt., Thuc.
sound in mind, sound-minded, Eur., Plat.
of words, opinions, and the like, sound, wholesome, wise, Il., Thuc., Plat.: often with a negat., λόγος οὐχ ὑγ. Hdt.; μηδὲν ὑγιὲς φρονῶν Soph.; οὐδὲν ὑγ. λέγειν Eur., etc.
adv. ὑγιῶς, healthily, soundly, κρίνειν, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ὑγραίνω
div1.sense: to wet, moisten, Eur., Xen.: of a river, to water a country, Eur.

div1.head: ὑγρομελής
div1.sense: with supple, soft limbs, Xen.

div1.head: ὑγροπορέω
div1.sense: to go through the water, Anth.

div1.head: ὑγρός
div1.sense: wet, moist, running, fluid, Hom., etc.; ὑγρὸν ἔλαιον, i. e. olive-oil, as opp. to fat, Hom.; ὑγρὸν ὕδωρ running water, Od.; ἄνεμοι ὑγρὸν ἀέντες winds blowing moist or rainy, as opp. to dry, parching, Od.
ἡ ὑγρά, Ionic ὑγρή, the moist, i. e. the sea, Hom.; so, ὑγρὰ κέλευθα the watery ways, i. e. the sea, Hom.; and ὑγρά alone, opp. to ἀπείρων γαῖα, Hom.
τὸ ὑγρόν and τὰ ὑγρά wet, moisture, water, Hdt.
μέτρα ὑγρὰ καὶ ξηρά liquid and dry measure, Plat.
θῆρες ὑγροί water- animals, opp. to πεζοί, Anth.

soft, pliant, supple, lithe, Lat. mollis, of the eagleʼs back, Pind.; of youthful limbs, Plat.; ὑγρὰ ἔχειν τὰ σκέλη, of a horse, Xen.; so of colts, γόνατα ὑγρῶς κάμπτειν, ὑγρῶς τοῖς σκέλεσι χρῆσθαι (cf. Virgilʼs mollia crura reponit), Xen.; so, ὑ. ἄκανθος ( Virg. mollis acanthus), Theocr.
languid, feeble, of one dying, Soph., Eur.
of the eyes, swimming, melting, languishing, ὄμμασιν ὑγρὰ δεδορκώς Anth., etc.
metaph. of persons, facile, soft-tempered, pliant, easy, Plut.: luxurious, ὑ. πρὸς τὴν διαίταν Plut.

div1.head: ὑγρότης
div1.sense: wetness, moisture, Plat.
pliancy, suppleness, Xen.: of a flame, flickering motion, lambency, Eur.
languor, Plut.

div1.head: ὑγρόφθογγος
div1.sense: making a gurgling sound, Anth.

div1.head: ὑγρώσσω
div1.sense: to make wet, moisten, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑδαρής
div1.sense: of wine, mixed with too much water, watery, washy, Xen.:—metaph. washy, feeble, languid, Aesch., Arist.

div1.head: ὑδασιστεγής
div1.sense: water-proof, Anth.

div1.head: ὑδάτινος
div1.sense: of water, watery, ὑδ. νάρκισσος that loves the water, Anth.
like ὑγρός II, pliant, supple, Anth.

div1.head: ὑδάτιον
div1.sense: a rivulet, Plat.

div1.head: ὑδατόεις
div1.sense: watery, like water, Anth.
transparent as water, thin, fine, Anth.

div1.head: ὑδατοποσία
div1.sense: a drinking of water, Luc.

div1.head: ὑδατοποτέω
div1.sense: to drink water, Luc.

div1.head: ὑδατοτρεφής
div1.sense: growing in or by the water, Od.

div1.head: ὑδατόω
div1.sense: to make watery:—Pass. to be liquid, watery, Anth.

div1.head: ὕδερος
div1.sense: dropsy, Arist.

div1.head: ὑδραίνω
div1.sense: to water the earth, of a river, Eur.; ὑδρ. τινά to wash, sprinkle with water, Eur.:—Mid. to wash oneself, bathe, ὑδρηναμένη Od.; λουτρὰ ὑδράνασθαι χροΐ to pour water over oneʼs body, Eur.
ὑδραίνειν χοάς τινι to pour libations to one, Eur.

div1.head: ὕδρα
div1.sense: a hydra, water-serpent, of the Lernaean hydra, Hes., Soph.; ὕδραν τέμνειν, proverb. of labour in vain, because two heads sprang up for every one which was cut off, Plat.

div1.head: ὑδρεία
div1.sense: a drawing water, fetching water, Thuc., etc.
a watering-place, Plut.

div1.head: ὑδρεῖον
div1.sense: a water-bucket, well-bucket, Hdt.
a water-tank, Strab.

div1.head: ὑδρεύω
div1.sense: to draw, fetch or carry water, Od., Theogn.:—Mid. to draw water for oneself, fetch water, πολῖται Od., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ὑδρηλός
div1.sense: watery, wet, Od., Aesch.; κρωσσοὶ ὕδρ. water pots, Eur.

div1.head: ὑδρία
div1.sense: a water-pot, pitcher, urn, Ar.:— proverb., ἐπὶ θύραις τὴν ὑδρίαν to break the pitcher at the door, = "thereʼs many a slip ʼtwixt cup and lip, " Arist.
a vessel of any kind, a pot of money, Ar.
the balloting urn in the law-courts, Isocr., Dem.
a cinerary urn, Ar., Luc.

div1.head: ὑδριάς
div1.sense: of the water, Anth.

div1.head: ὑδροειδής
div1.sense: like water, watery, Eur.

div1.head: ὑδρόεις
div1.sense: fond of the water, Eur.

div1.head: Ὑδρομέδουσα
div1.sense: water-ruler, name of a frog in Batr.

div1.head: ὑδροποσία
div1.sense: water-drinking, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ὑδροποτέω
div1.sense: to drink water, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ὑδροπότης
div1.sense: a water-drinker, Xen.: in Comic phrase, a thin-blooded, mean-spirited fellow, Anth.

div1.head: ὑδρορρόα
div1.sense: a water-course, whether on the ground, a conduit, canal, sluice, Ar.; or on the roof, a gutter, spout, Ar.

div1.head: ὕδρος
div1.sense: a water-snake, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ὑδροφορέω
div1.sense: to carry water, Xen.

div1.head: ὑδροφορία
div1.sense: a water-carrying, a festival of Apollo, Luc.

div1.head: ὑδροφόρος
div1.sense: carrying water, Plut.
as Subst., ὑδρ., a water-carrier, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ὑδροχόος
div1.sense: the water-pourer, name of the constellation Aquarius, Anth.

div1.head: ὑδρόχυτος
div1.sense: gushing with water, Eur.

div1.head: ὑδρωπικός
div1.sense: dropsical: metaph., ναῦς ὑδρ. Anth.

div1.head: ὕδωρ
div1.etym: Epic also ὕδει as if from ὕδος
div1.sense: water, of any kind, but in Hom. rarely of sea-water (which he calls ἁλμυρὸν ὕδωρ) ;— also in pl., ὕδατʼ αἰενάοντα Od.; ὕδατα Καφίσια the waters of Cephisos, Pind.:— ὕδωρ κατὰ χειρός water for washing the hands, Ar.; ὕ. ἐπὶ χεῖρας ἔχευαν Hom.—Proverbs., γράφειν τι εἰς ὕδωρ of anything untrustworthy, Soph.; ἐν ὕδατι γρ. Plat.; ὅταν τὸ ὕδωρ πνίγῃ, τί δεῖ ἐπιπίνειν; if water chokes, what more can be done? of a desperate case, Arist.
rain-water, rain, Il., Hdt., Attic;—more definitely, ὕδωρ ἐξ οὐρανοῦ Thuc., etc.; Ζεὺς ὕδωρ ὕει, ὁ θεὸς ὕδωρ ποιεῖ Ar.
for the phrase ἐν ὕδατι βρέχεσθαι, Hdt., v. βρέχω.

in Attic law-phrase, τὸ ὕδωρ was the water of the water-clock (κλεψύδρα) , Dem.; ἐν τῷ ἐμῷ ὕδατι, ἐπὶ τοῦ ἐμοῦ ὕδατος in the time allowed me, Dem.; οὐκ ἐνδέχεται πρὸς τὸ αὐτὸ ὕ. εἰπεῖν one cannot say (all) in one speech, Dem.; ἐπίλαβε τὸ ὕ. stop the water (which was done while the speech was interrupted by the calling of evidence and reading of documents), Dem.; ἀποδιδόναι τινὶ τὸ ὕ. to give him the turn of speaking, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὕειος
div1.sense: of or belonging to swine, ὑεία κοιλία pigʼs tripe, Ar.:— θηρίον ὕ., as a type of brutish ignorance, Plat.

div1.head: Ὑέλη
div1.sense: Velia in Lower Italy, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑετόεις
div1.sense: rainy, Anth.

div1.head: ὑετός
div1.sense: rain, Lat. pluvius, Il., Hes., Ar.:— esp. a heavy shower, Lat. nimbus, whereas ὄμβρος, Lat. imber, is a lasting rain, and ψεκάς or ψακάς a drizzling rain, Xen., etc.
as adj. in Sup. ἄνεμοι ὑετώτατοι the rainiest winds, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑηνία
div1.sense: swinishness, swinish stupidity, Ar.

div1.head: ὑηνός
div1.sense: swinish, Plat.

div1.head: Ὕης
div1.sense: epith. of Ζεὺς ὄμβριος, and of Bacchus:—to which of these the cry of Ὕης ἄττης in Dem. should be referred, is doubtful.

div1.head: ὑθλέω
div1.sense: to talk nonsense, trifle, prate, Lat. nugari, Ar.

div1.head: ὕθλος
div1.sense: idle talk, nonsense, Plat., Dem.; in pl., ὕθλους λέγειν, like Lat. nugae, Plat.

div1.head: ὑΐδιον
div1.sense: Dim. of ὗς, Xen.
Dim. of υἱός, Ar.

div1.head: ὑϊδοῦς
div1.sense: a grandson, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ὑϊκός
div1.sense: of or for swine, ὑϊκόν τι πάσχειν to have something of the swineʼs nature, Xen.

div1.head: υἱοθεσία
div1.sense: adoption as a son, NTest.

div1.head: υἱός
div1.sense: etc. A son, Lat. filius, Hom., etc.; υἱὸν ποιεῖσθαί τινα to adopt him as a son, Aeschin.; υἱεῖς ἄνδρες grown up sons, Dem.:—rarely of animals, NTest.
periphr., υἷες Ἀχαιῶν, for Ἀχαιοί, Il.; cf. παῖς.
div1.etym: Hom. sometimes makes the 1st syll. short, as if it were ὑός.

div1.head: υἱωνός
div1.sense: a grandson, Hom., Plut.

div1.head: ὕλαγμα
div1.sense: the bark of a dog, Eur.: metaph., νηπίοις ὑλάγμασιν with idle snarlings, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑλαγμός
div1.sense: a barking, baying, Il., Xen.

div1.head: ὑλαγωγέω
div1.sense: to carry wood, Dem.

div1.head: ὑλαῖος
div1.sense: of the forest, savage, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑλακή
div1.sense: a barking, howling, Anth., Plut.

div1.head: ὑλακόμωρος
div1.sense: always barking, still howling or yelling, Od.

div1.head: ὑλακτέω
div1.sense: to bark, bay, howl, of dogs, Il., Ar.; of hounds, to give tongue, Xen.
metaph., κραδίη ὑλακτεῖ howls for rage, Od.; c. acc. cogn. to yell forth bold and shameless words, Soph.; ἄμουσʼ ὑλακτῶν howling his uncouth songs, Eur.
trans. to bark at, τινά Ar., Isocr.

div1.head: ὑλακτητής
div1.sense: a barker, Anth.

div1.head: ὑλάω
div1.sense: to howl, bark, bay, of dogs, Od.: so in Mid., κύνες οὐχ ὑλάοντο Od.
trans. to bark or bay at, τινά Od., Theocr.

div1.head: ὑλειώτης
div1.sense: a forester, Anth.

div1.head: ὑλήεις
div1.sense: woody, wooded, Hom., Soph., Eur.; ἀταρπὸς ὑλ. a path through the wood, Anth.
dwelling in the woods, Anth.

div1.head: ὑληκοίτης
div1.sense: one who lodges in the wood, Hes.

div1.head: ὕλη
div1.sense: Lat. sylva, a wood, forest, woodland, Hom., Hdt., etc.; τὰ δένδρα καὶ ὕλη fruit-trees and forest-trees, Thuc.: copse, brushwood, opp. to timber-trees, Xen.
wood cut down, firewood, fuel, Hom., etc.
like Lat. materia, stuff of which a thing is made, the raw material, wood, timber, Od., Hdt.
in Philosophy, matter, Arist.
subject matter, Arist.

div1.head: ὑληωρός
div1.sense: watching the wood, Anth.

div1.head: ὑλίζω
div1.sense: to filter, strain: v. διυλίζω.

div1.head: ὑλοβάτης
div1.sense: one who haunts the woods, Anth.

div1.head: ὑλόκομος
div1.sense: thick grown with wood, Eur.

div1.head: ὑλοσκόπος
div1.sense: watching over woods, Anth.

div1.head: ὑλοτομέω
div1.sense: to cut or fell wood, Hes.

div1.head: ὑλοτομία
div1.sense: the cutting or felling of wood, Arist.

div1.head: ὑλοτόμος
div1.sense: cutting or felling wood, Il.:— as Subst. ὑλοτόμος, a wood-cutter, woodman, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ὑλότομος
div1.sense: pass. cut in the wood: τὸ ὑλότομον a plant used as a charm, Hhymn.

div1.head: ὑλουργός
div1.sense: working wood: as Subst. ὑλουργός, ὁ, a carpenter or woodman, Eur.

div1.head: ὑλοφάγος
div1.sense: feeding in the woods, Hes.

div1.head: ὑλοφορβός
div1.sense: feeding in the woods, Eur.

div1.head: ὑλοφόρος
div1.sense: a wood-carrier, Anth.

div1.head: ὑλώδης
div1.sense: woody, wooded, Thuc.; τὰ ὑλώδη wooded ground, Xen.
turbid, muddy, Plut.

div1.head: ὑλωρός
div1.sense: a forester, Arist.

div1.head: ὑμέναιος
div1.sense: hymenaeus, the wedding or bridal song, sung by the brideʼs attendants as they led her to the bridegroomʼs house, Il., Trag.
a wedding, Soph., Eur.; and in pl., Soph., Eur.
= Ὑμήν, Hymen, the god of marriage, addressed in wedding-songs, Ὑμὴν ὦ Ὑμέναιʼ ἄναξ Eur.; Doric Ὑμὰν ὦ Ὑμέναιε Theocr.

div1.head: ὑμεναιόω
div1.sense: to sing the wedding-song, Aesch.
to wed, take to wife, Theocr.; proverb., πρίν κεν λύκος οἶν ὑμεναιοῖ Ar.

div1.head: ὑμενήϊος
div1.sense: epith. of Bacchus, Anth.

div1.head: ὑμενόπτερος
div1.sense: membrane-winged, Luc.

div1.head: ὑμέτερος
div1.sense: your, yours, Lat. vester, Hom., etc.; with a Pron. added in gen., ὑμέτερος ἑκάστου θυμός the courage of each of you, Il.; ὑμέτερος αὐτῶν θυμός your own mind, Od.;— ὑμέτερόνδε to your house, Il.:— τὸ ὑμέτερον your part, your business, Hdt.; τὸ δʼ ὑμ. πρᾶξαι your character is to do so and so, Thuc.:—with the Article, αἱ ὑμέτεραι ἐλπίδες hopes raised by you, Thuc.; τῇ ὑμ. παρακελεύσει for the purpose of advising you, Plat.

div1.head: ὑμήν
div1.sense: a thin skin, membrane, Arist.

div1.head: ὑμήν
div1.sense: Hymen, the god of marriages, v. Ὑμέναιος.
div1.etym: ῡ, whereas in Ὑμέναιος, υ is short.

div1.head: ὑμναγόρης
div1.sense: a singer of hymns, Anth.

div1.head: ὑμνέω
div1.sense: with acc. to sing, laud, sing of, Lat. canere, c. acc., Hes., Trag.:—also in Prose, to celebrate, commemorate, Hdt., Xen.;—c. dupl. acc., ἃ τὴν πόλιν ὕμνησα the points wherein I praised our city, Thuc.:—Pass. to be sung of, Ἀργεῖοι ὑμνέαται (Ionic for -ηνται) have been praised, Hdt.; ὑμνηθήσεται πόλις Eur.; αἱ ὑμνούμεναι φιλίαι the famous friendships, Arist.
c. acc. cogn. to sing, Aesch., Eur.

to tell over and over and over again, to repeat, recite, rehearse, Lat. decantare, Plat.; ὑμνήσεις κακά wilt sing continually of thy ills, Soph.; τὰν ἐμὰν ὑμνεῦσαι (Ionic for -οῦσαι) ἀπιστοσύναν ever singing of my want of faith, Eur.:—Pass., βαίʼ, ἀεὶ δʼ ὑμνούμενα few words, but such as oft repeated, Soph.
intr. to sing, chant, Thuc., Xen.
in a pass. sense, φῆμαι ὑμνήσουσι περὶ τὰ ὦτα will ring in their ears, Plat. [In Eur. sometimes υ.

div1.head: ὑμνητέος
div1.sense: one must praise, Plat., Luc.

div1.head: ὑμνητής
div1.sense: a singer, praiser, Plat.

div1.head: ὑμνητός
div1.sense: sung of, praised, lauded, Pind.

div1.head: ὑμνοθέτης
div1.sense: a composer of hymns, a lyric poet, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: ὑμνοποιός
div1.sense: making hymns: as Subst., ὑμν., ὁ, a minstrel, Eur.

div1.head: ὑμνοπόλος
div1.sense: busied with songs of praise: as Subst., ὑμν., ὁ, a poet, minstrel, Anth.

div1.head: ὕμνος
div1.sense: a hymn, festive song or ode, in praise of gods or heroes, Od.; ὕμνος θεῶν to or in honour of the gods, Aesch.; τιμῶν θεὸν ὕμνοισιν Eur.:—in Trag. also of mournful songs, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ὑμνῳδέω
div1.sense: to sing a hymn or song of praise: generally, to sing, ὑμν. θρῆνον Aesch.
= χρησμῳδέω, Eur. [ῠ in Aesch.]

div1.head: ὑμνῳδία
div1.sense: the singing of a hymn, hymning, Eur.
= χρησμῳδία, a prophetic strain, Eur.

div1.head: ὑμνῳδός
div1.sense: singing hymns, ὑμν. κόραι the minstrel maids, Eur.

div1.head: ὑμός
div1.sense: your, Hom., Hes.
in Pind. also for σός.

div1.head: ὕνις
div1.sense: a ploughshare, Babr., Plut.

div1.head: ὑομουσία
div1.sense: swineʼs music, swinish taste in music, Ar.

div1.head: ὑόπρῳρος
div1.sense: of a ship, having a beak turned up like a swineʼs snout, Plut.

div1.head: ὑοσκύαμος
div1.sense: hen-bane, hyoscyamus, Xen.

div1.head: ὑοφόρβιον
div1.sense: a herd of swine, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπάγγελος
div1.sense: summoned by messenger, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπαγκαλίζω
div1.sense: to clasp in the arms, embrace, Eur.:—Pass., γένος ὑπηγκαλισμένη having them clasped in her arms, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπαγκάλισμα
div1.sense: that which is clasped in the arms, a beloved one, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ὑπαγορεύω
div1.sense: to dictate, Lat. praeire verbis, Xen., Dem.
to suggest, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπάγω
div1.sense: trans. to lead or bring under, ὕπαγε ζυγὸν ἵππους bring them under the yoke, Il.; simply, ὑπάγειν ἡμιόνους Od.
metaph. to bring under oneʼs power, Hdt., Luc.:—Mid. to bring under oneʼs own power, reduce, Thuc.
to bring a person before the judgment-seat (the ὑπό refers to his being set beneath the judgeʼs seat), Hdt.; ὑπ. τινὰ εἰς δίκην Thuc.; ὑπ. τινὰ θανάτου on a capital charge, Xen.

to lead slowly on, to lead on by degrees, τὰς κύνας Xen.:— to lead on by art or deceit, Hdt., Xen.; ὑπ. τινὰ εἰς ἐλπίδα Eur.:—so in Mid., Xen.; ὑπ. τοὺς Θηβαίους to win them, Dem.:—in Mid. also to suggest a thing so as to lead a person on, Eur., Xen.
to take away from under, withdraw, Il.: Pass., ὑπαγομένου τοῦ χώματος Thuc.
to draw off, τὸ στράτευμα Thuc.
intr., of an army, to draw off or retire slowly, Hdt., Thuc.
to go slowly forwards, draw on, ὕπαγʼ ὦ, ὕπαγʼ ὦ on with you ! Eur.; ὕπαγε, τί μέλλεις; Ar.:—of an army, to come gradually on, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπαγωγή
div1.sense: a leading on gradually, Xen.
(from ὑπάγω intr.) a retreat, withdrawal, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπαείδω
div1.sense: to sing by way of accompaniment, in tmesi, Λίνον δʼ ὑπὸ καλὸν ἄειδεν Il.; ὑπ. μέλος Ar.; ὑπ. τινί to accompany with the voice, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπαιδείδοικα
div1.etym: Epic for ὑποδέδοικα, perf. of ὑποδείδω

div1.head: ὑπαιδέομαι
div1.sense: to shew some respect for, τινα Xen.

div1.head: ὕπαιθα
div1.sense: out under, slipping away, Il.
prep. with gen. under, at the side of, Il.

div1.head: ὑπαίθριος
div1.sense: under the sky, in the open air, a-field, ὑπ. κατακοιμηθῆναι, of an army, Hdt., Thuc.; ὑπ. δρόσοι Aesch.

div1.head: ὕπαιθρος
div1.sense: as Subst., ἐν ὑπαίθρῳ, sub Dio, in the open air, Xen.
τὰ ὕπαιθρα, the field, the open country, Polyb.

div1.head: ὑπαίθω
div1.sense: to set on fire below or secretly, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπαινίσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to intimate darkly, hint at, Dem., Plut.

div1.head: ὑπαΐσσω
div1.sense: to dart beneath, c. acc., Il.
to dart from under, c. gen., Il.:—also, ὑπᾴξας διὰ θυρῶν Soph.

div1.head: ὑπαισχύνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be somewhat ashamed, τινά τι of a thing before a person, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπαίτιος
div1.sense: under accusation, called to account, responsible, τινος or ὑπέρ τινος for a thing, Antipho; τινι to a person, Xen.; ὑπαίτιόν ἐστί τί τινι a charge is made against one, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπακοή
div1.sense: obedience, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπακούω
div1.sense: absol. to listen, hearken, give ear, Hom., Eur.
to make answer when called, Od., Theocr.
foll. by a case, to listen or hearken to, give ear to, attend to, τινός Ar., etc.; also, ὑπ. τινί Thuc., etc.
Special senses:
of porters, to answer a knock at the door, ὑπ. τινί Plat., Theophr.; ὁ ὑπακούσας the porter, Xen.
of a judge, to listen to a complainant, τινί Xen.:—but of accused persons, to answer to a charge, Dem.

of dependents and subjects, to submit to, τινός Hdt., Xen.; τινί Ar., Thuc.: also to yield to, comply with, τινί Plat.:—c. gen. rei, to give ear to, Xen.; ὑπ. τῷ ξυμφόρῳ τινός to comply with his interest, Thuc.:—absol. to give way, submit, comply, Hdt.
to answer oneʼs expectations, to succeed, Luc.
metaph., αὐγαῖς ἡλίου ὑπ. to be subject to the sunʼs rays, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπαλείφω
div1.sense: to lay thinly on, to spread like salve; in Mid., ὑπαλείφεσθαι φάρμακον Plat.
to anoint, τὼ ὀφθαλμώ Ar.:—in Mid. to anoint oneself, Ar.; ὑπ. τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς to anoint oneʼs eyes, Xen.:— Pass. of the eyes, ὑπαληλιμμένοι Xen.

div1.head: ὑπαλεύομαι
div1.sense: Epic Dep. ὑπαλευάμενος θάνατον Od.; ὑπαλεύεο φήμην (imperat.) Hes.

div1.head: ὑπαλλαγή
div1.sense: an interchange, exchange, change, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπάλλαγμα
div1.sense: that which is exchanged, νόμισμα ὑπάλλαγμα τῆς χρείας money is the exchangeable representative of demand, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπαλλάσσω
div1.sense: to exchange, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπάλπειος
div1.sense: under the Alps;— ἡ ὑπαλπεία (sc. χώρα) sub-Alpine Italy, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπάλυξις
div1.sense: a shunning, escape, Hom.

div1.head: ὑπαλύσκω
div1.sense: to avoid, shun, flee from, escape, Hom.

div1.head: ὑπαναγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to read by way of preface, premise by reading, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπαναλίσκω
div1.sense: to waste away, spend or consume gradually, Thuc., Plut., etc.

div1.head: ὑπανάστασις
div1.sense: a rising up from oneʼs seat, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπαναστατέος
div1.sense: one must rise up, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπαναχωρέω
div1.sense: to retire slowly, Thuc.

div1.head: ὕπανδρος
div1.sense: under a man, subject to him, married, NTest., Plut.

div1.head: ὑπάνειμι
div1.sense: to come on, creep on, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπανιάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be somewhat distressed, opt. -ιῷντο Ar.

div1.head: ὑπανίημι
div1.sense: to remit or relax a little, Plut.:—intr., τοῦ φόβου ὑπανέντος (aor2 part.) Plut.

div1.head: ὑπανίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass. with aor2 and perf. act. to rise, stand up, Theogn.; of game, to start up, to be sprung, Xen.
ὑπ. τῆς ἕδρης to rise up from oneʼs seat to make room or shew respect to another, Lat. assurgere alicui, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: ὑπανοίγω
div1.sense: to open from below: to open underhand or secretly, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπαντάω
div1.sense: to come or go to meet, either as a friend or in arms, τινί Xen., etc.:—also c. gen., Soph.
metaph. to meet, reply or object to, τινί Eur.

div1.head: ὑπαντιάζω
div1.sense: to come or go to meet, step forth to meet, encounter, absol., Il., Aesch., etc.: c. dat., Aesch., Xen., etc; also c. acc., Hdt., Plut.

div1.head: ὕπαντρος
div1.sense: with caverns underneath, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπαπειλέω
div1.sense: to threaten underhand, τινί Xen.

div1.head: ὑπάπειμι
div1.sense: to depart stealthily or slowly, to withdraw, retreat, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπαποκινέω
div1.sense: intr. to move off secretly, sneak away from, c. gen., Ar.

div1.head: ὑπάργυρος
div1.sense: having silver underneath; hence,
containing silver, veined with silver, πέτρα, χθών Eur.:— containing a proportion of silver, metaph. of men, Plat.
sold or hired for silver, mercenary, venal, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπαρκτέος
div1.sense: one must begin, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπάρκτιος
div1.sense: towards the north, Plut.

div1.head: ὕπαρνος
div1.sense: with a lamb under it, i. e. suckling a lamb or (metaph.) a babe, Eur.

div1.head: ὕπαρ
div1.sense: a waking vision, opp. to ὄναρ (a dream), οὐκ ὄναρ, ἀλλʼ ὕπαρ no illusive dream, but a reality, Od.; so Pind., Aesch.
the acc. is used as adv., in a waking state, awake, Plat.; ὄναρ ἢ ὕπαρ ζῆν to pass life asleep or awake, Plat.
ὕπαρ in reality, actually, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπαρχή
div1.sense: the beginning: ἐξ ὑπαρχῆς, from the beginning, afresh, anew, Lat. denuo, Soph., Dem.

div1.head: ὕπαρχος
div1.sense: commanding under another, a lieutenant, lieutenant-governor, viceroy, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ὑπάρχω
div1.sense: to begin, make a beginning, absol., Od., Eur., etc.
c. gen. to make a beginning of, ἀδικίης Hdt.; πολλῶν κακῶν Eur., etc.
c. part to begin doing, ὑπῆρξαν ἄδικα ποιεῦντες Hdt.; ὑπάρχει εὖ ποιῶν τινα Xen.

c. acc., ὑπ. εὐεργεσίας εἴς τινα or τινι to begin [doing] kindnesses to one, Dem., Aeschin.:—Pass. to be begun, τὰ ἔκ τινος ὑπαργμένα (Ionic for ὑπηργ-) Hdt.:—impers., ὑπῆρκτο αὐτοῦ a beginning of it had been made, Thuc.
to begin to be, come into being, arise, spring up, Aesch., etc.

to be in existence, to be there, to be ready, Hdt., Attic;—c. gen., ὑπάρχει τῶνδε there is store of these things, Aesch.:—oft. in part., ἡ ὑπάρχουσα οὐσία the existing property, Isocr.; τὰ ὑπ. ἁμαρτήματα Thuc.; τῆς ὑπ. τιμῆς for the current price, Dem.
simply to be, Trag., Thuc., etc.
sometimes with a part., much like τυγχάνω, τοιαῦτα αὐτῷ ὑπῆρχε ἐόντα Hdt.; ὑπ. ἐχθρὸς ὤν Dem.
like ὑπόκειμαι II. 2, to be laid down, to be taken for granted, Plat.; τούτων ὑπαρχόντων quae cum ita sint, Plat.
to belong to, fall to one, accrue, ὑπάρχει τινί τι one has, Hdt., Thuc.; ἡ ὑπάρχουσα φύσις your own proper nature, its normal condition, Thuc.
of persons, ὑπ. τινί to be devoted to one, Xen., Dem.; καθʼ ὑμῶν ὑπάρξει ἐκείνῳ he will be on his side against you, Dem.
often in neut. pl. part., τὰ ὑπάρχοντα,
existing circumstances, present advantages, Thuc., Xen., etc.
what belongs to one, oneʼs possessions, means, Thuc., etc.
impers., ὑπάρχει, the fact is that . . , c. acc. et inf., Soph.
it is allowed, it is possible, c. dat. et inf., ὑπ. μοι εἶναι or ποιεῖν τι Thuc., Plat.:— absol., ὥσπερ ὑπῆρχε as well as was possible, Thuc.
in neut. part., like ἐξόν, παρόν, etc., ὑπάρχον ὑμῖν πολεμεῖν since it is allowed you to make war, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπασπίδιος
div1.sense: under shield, covered with a shield, τὸν ὑπ. κόσμον the arms of Ajax, Soph.; ὑπ. κοῖτον ἰαύειν to sleep an armed sleep, sleep in arms, Eur.: neut. pl. ὑπασπίδια as adv., Il.

div1.head: ὑπασπίζω
div1.sense: to serve as shield-bearer, τινί Pind., Eur.

div1.head: ὑπασπιστής
div1.sense: a shield-bearer, armour-bearer, esquire, Hdt., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ὑπατεύω
div1.sense: to be consul, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπάτη
div1.sense: (sc. χορδή) , the lowest note of the three which formed the Gr. scale (v. μέση, νεάτη, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπατικός
div1.sense: of consular rank, Lat. consularis, Plut.

div1.head: ὕπατος
div1.sense: like Lat. summus for supremus, the highest, uppermost, of Zeus, ὕπατος κρειόντων, θεῶν ὕπ., Hom.; οἱ ὕπατοι the gods above, Lat. superi, opp. to οἱ χθόνιοι, Lat. inferi, Aesch.; ὕπατός τις some god above, Aesch.
simply of Place, ἐν πυρῇ ὑπάτῃ on the very top of the funeral pile, Il.
of Time, last, Lat. supremus, Soph., Anth.
of Quality, highest, best, Pind.
c. gen., like the prep. ὑπό, ὕπατος χώρας supreme over the land, Aesch.; ὕπατοι λεχέων high above the nest, Aesch.
as Subst., ὕπατος, the Roman consul, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: ὑπαυλέω
div1.sense: to play on the flute in accompaniment, Luc.

div1.head: ὕπαυλος
div1.sense: under or in the court, c. gen., σκηνῆς ὕπαυλος under shelter of the tent, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπαυχένιος
div1.sense: under the neck, Anth.: as Subst., ὑπαυχένιον, ου, a cushion for the neck, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπαφίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass., with aor2 and perf. act., to step back slowly, to withdraw, Antipho.

div1.head: ὕπαφρος
div1.sense: somewhat frothy, ὄμμα ὕπ. an eye dim with tears, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπάφρων
div1.sense: somewhat stupid, Hdt.

div1.head: ὒ
div1.sense: ὒ, ὖ, a sound to imitate a person snuffing a feast, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπέγγυος
div1.sense: having given surety, liable to be called to account or punished, responsible, Aesch.; ὑπ. πλὴν θανάτου liable to any punishment short of death, Hdt.: c. dat., τὸ γὰρ ὑπέγγυον δίκᾳ καὶ θεοῖσιν liability to human and divine justice, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπεγχέω
div1.sense: to pour in yet more, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπειδόμην
div1.sense: to view from below, to behold, Eur.
metaph. to mistrust, suspect, Eur.:— ὑφοράω is used as pres.

div1.head: ὑπεικαθεῖν
div1.sense: Soph., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπεικτέος
div1.sense: one must yield, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπείκω
div1.sense: to retire, withdraw, depart, νεῶν from the ships, Il.; ὑπ. τινὶ ἕδρης to retire from oneʼs seat for another (cf. ὑπανίσταμαι) , Od.; ὑπ. τινὶ λόγων, i. e. to allow him to speak first, Xen.

to yield, give way, τιμαῖς ὑπ. to give way to authority, Soph.; ὑπ. τινί Xen.: absol. to give way, comply, Hom., etc.; τὸ ὑπεῖκον, οἱ ὑπείκοντες, Eur.:—c. inf., νῶν ὑπεῖκε τὸν κασίγνητον μολεῖν concede to us that he may come, Soph.
c. acc., χεῖρας ἐμὰς ὑπόειξε he scaped my hands, Il.

div1.head: ὕπειμι
div1.sense: to be under, Lat. subesse, c. dat., Il.; πολλῇσι ἵπποις πῶλοι ὑπῆσαν under many mares were sucking foals, Il.; of horses, to be under the yoke, to be yoked in the chariot, Hdt.
to be or lie underneath, Hdt., Aesch.
to be laid down, ὑπόντος τοῦδε this being granted, Eur.
to remain concealed, lurk, Xen.
of things, to be left remaining, remain, be at command, Hdt., Attic
to be subjected or subject, Eur.

div1.head: ὕπειμι
div1.sense: to steal secretly upon one, Lat. subire, c. acc., Ar.
to depart gradually or secretly, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεῖπον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, ὑπαγορεύω being used instead
div1.sense: to say as a foundation or preface, to premise, suggest, Eur., Thuc., etc.
to subjoin, add, Ar., Dem.
to suggest an explanation, explain, interpret, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπείρ
div1.sense: used when a long syll. is needed before a vowel, e. g. ὑπεὶρ ἅλα Hom.

div1.head: ὑπεισδύομαι
div1.sense: to get in secretly, to slip or steal in, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεισέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to enter secretly, to come into oneʼs mind, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπέκκαυμα
div1.sense: combustible matter, fuel, Xen.:—metaph. an incentive, Lat. fomes, ἔρωτος Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέκκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be carried out to a place of safety, to be stowed safe away, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπεκκλίνω
div1.sense: to bend aside, escape, Ar.: c. acc. to shun, avoid, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεκκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry out or away secretly, Thuc., etc.:—Mid., ὑπεκκομίσασθαι πάντα to get all oneʼs goods carried secretly out, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεκλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to carry off underhand, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπεκλύω
div1.sense: to loosen or weaken gradually, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεκπέμπω
div1.sense: to send out secretly, Thuc., Eur.: —Pass., c. acc. loci, τὸ Φωκέων πέδον ὑπεξεπέμφθην I was sent out secretly to Phocis, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπεκπλέω
div1.sense: to sail out secretly, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεκπροθέω
div1.sense: to run forth from under, outstrip, Il.:—absol. to run on before, Hom.

div1.head: ὑπεκπρολύω
div1.sense: to loose from under, ἡμιόνους μὲν ὑπεκπροέλυσαν ἀπήνης loosed the mules from under the carriage-yoke, Od.

div1.head: ὑπεκπρορέω
div1.sense: to flow forth under, Od.

div1.head: ὑπεκπροφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee away secretly, escape and flee, Hom.

div1.head: ὑπεκρέω
div1.sense: to flow out under:—metaph. to pass away gradually, Plat.: to slip out, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεκρήγνυμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be gradually broken away, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεκρίπτω
div1.sense: to cast down out of, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεκσῴζω
div1.sense: to save by drawing away from, Aesch.: absol., αὐτὸν ὑπεξεσάωσεν (Epic for -έσωνσεν) Il.

div1.head: ὑπεκτίθεμαι
div1.sense: Mid. to bring oneʼs goods to a place of safety, carry safely away, ἔστʼ ἂν τέκνα ὑπεκθέωνται (3rd pl. aor2 subj.) Hdt.; so in Attic:— Pass. to be carried out to a place of safety, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεκτρέπω
div1.sense: to turn gradually or secretly from a thing, τί τινος Soph.:—Mid. to turn aside from, c. acc., Plat.; c. inf., ὑπεκτραπέσθαι μὴ οὐ ξυνεκσώζειν to decline the task of helping to save, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπεκτρέχω
div1.sense: to run out from under, escape from, c. acc., Hdt., Soph., etc.;—c. inf., ἢν ἐγὼ μὴ θανεῖν ὑπεκδράμω Eur.
to run out beyond, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπεκφέρω
div1.sense: to carry out a little, ὑπεξέφερεν σάκος lifted it a little outwards, so that Teucer could take shelter under it, Il.
to carry out from under, υἱὸν ὑπεξέφερε πολέμοιο Il.: to carry away, bear onward, Od.
intr., ὑπ. ἡμέρης ὁδῷ to get the start by a dayʼs journey, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεκφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee away or escape secretly, Hom., Soph.
mostly c. acc. to escape from, Il., Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπεκχαλάω
div1.sense: to slacken gradually, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπεκχωρέω
div1.sense: to withdraw or retire slowly or unnoticed, Hdt.:—c. dat. pers. to retire and give place to another, Plat.; ὑπ. τῷ θανάτῳ to make way for death, i. e. to escape it, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπελαύνω
div1.sense: (sub. τὸν ἵππον) to ride up so as to meet, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπεμνήμυκε
div1.sense: he hangs down his head, stands with head hung down, Il.

div1.head: ὑπεναντιόομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to oppose secretly, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπέκ
div1.sense: poet. prep. with gen. out from under, from beneath, away from, Il.

div1.head: ὑπεκδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have under one, of a cow, πόρτιν μαστῷ ὑπ. to have a calf under her udder, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπεκδύομαι
div1.sense: Mid., with aor2 act., to slip out of, escape, c. acc., Eur.; c. gen., Plut.; absol., ὑπεκδύς having slipped out, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεκθέω
div1.sense: to run off secretly or gradually, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεκκαλύπτω
div1.sense: to uncover below or a little, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπεναντίος
div1.sense: set over against, meeting, ἀλλήλοισιν Hes.
set against, opposite, of enemies in battle, Thuc.; οἱ ὑπ. the enemy, Xen.
opposed, opposite: c. dat. opposite or contrary to, Hdt., Xen.: —as Subst., τὸ ὑπεναντίον τούτου πέφυκε the contrary hereto generally happens, Hdt.; τὰ ὑπ. τούτων on the contrary, Hdt.
adv. -ίως, in a manner contrary to, τῷ νόμῳ Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπενδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give way a little, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπένδυμα
div1.sense: an undergarment, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπενδύω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass., ὑπενδεδυμένοι χιτῶνας having tunics on under their arms, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπένερθε
div1.sense: underneath, beneath, Hom., Ar.
under the earth, in the nether world, Lat. apud inferos, Od.
as prep., c. gen., under, beneath, Hom., Pind.

div1.head: ὑπεξάγω
div1.sense: to carry out from under, esp. out of danger, Hom., Hdt.
ὑπ. πόδα to withdraw gradually, retire slowly, Eur.; and so, without πόδα, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ὑπεξαιρέω
div1.sense: to take away from below, αἷμα ὑπ. to drain away blood, Soph.
to make away with, to destroy gradually, Eur.; τοὐπίκλημʼ ὑπεξελών having done away with the charge, Soph.:—Pass., Hdt., Thuc.
Mid. to take out privily for oneself, steal away, Il.
to put aside, except, exclude, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ὑπεξακρίζω
div1.sense: to ascend to the summit, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπεξαλέασθαι
div1.sense: Dep. to flee out from under, avoid, c. acc., Il., Hes.

div1.head: ὑπεξαναβαίνω
div1.sense: to step suddenly back, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑπεξανάγομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to put out to sea secretly, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπεξαναδύομαι
div1.sense: to come up from under, emerge, ὑπεξαναδὺς ἁλός Il.; ὑπ. κεφαλῇ to duck or stoop so as to avoid a blow, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑπεξανίσταμαι
div1.sense: ὑπ. τινι to rise and make room for him, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπεξαντλέω
div1.sense: to drain out from below, exhaust, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπέξειμι
div1.sense: to go away secretly, withdraw gradually, Hdt.; ὑπ. τινί to make way for one, give way to him, Dem.:—of fire or snow, to disappear gradually, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπεξελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive away gradually, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεξερύω
div1.sense: to draw out from under, draw away underhand, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go out from under: to go out secretly, withdraw, retire, Thuc., Dem.:—rarely c. acc. pers. to withdraw from, escape from, Thuc.
to rise up and quit oneʼs settlements, to emigrate, Hdt.
to go out to meet, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεξέχω
div1.sense: intr. to withdraw or retire secretly, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεξίστημι
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass., with aor2 and perf. act., to depart secretly, ὑπ. τῆς ἀρχῆς to give up all claim to it, like Lat. abdicare se magistratu, Hdt.; so c. inf., ὑπ. ἄρχειν Luc.
c. acc. to go out of the way of, to give place to, make way for, Xen.: c. dat. to yield to, give way to, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεραβέλτερος
div1.sense: above measure simple or silly, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπεράγαμαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to be exceedingly pleased, Plat.
to admire above measure, τινος for a thing, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπεραγανακτέω
div1.sense: to be exceeding angry or vexed at a thing, c. gen., Plat.; c. dat., Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπεραγαπάω
div1.sense: to love exceedingly, make much of, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπεραγωνιάω
div1.sense: to be in great distress, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ὑπεραής
div1.sense: blowing hard, Il.

div1.head: ὑπεραιμέω
div1.sense: to have over-much blood, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπεραίρω
div1.sense: to lift or raise up over, Plat.:— Mid. or Pass. to lift oneself above, to exalt oneself, be exalted, NTest.
intr.,
c. acc. to climb or get over, pass over, Lat. transcendere, Xen.; ὑπ. τὴν ἄκραν to double the cape, Xen.:—as military term, to outflank, Xen.
to transcend, excel, outdo, τινά τινι one in a thing, Dem.
to overshoot, go beyond, exceed, καιρόν Aesch.
to overflow, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπέραισχρος
div1.sense: exceeding foul or ugly, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπεραισχύνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to feel much ashamed, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπεραιωρέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to hang or be suspended over, project over, τινος Hdt.
in nautical language, c. gen. loci, to lie off a place, τῇσι νηυσὶ ὑπεραιωρηθέντες Φαληροῦ Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπέρακμος
div1.sense: past the bloom of youth, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερακοντίζω
div1.sense: to overshoot, i. e. to outdo, c. acc., Ar.; ὑπ. τινὰ κλέπτων to outdo one in stealing, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερακριβής
div1.sense: exceedingly exact, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερακρίζω
div1.sense: to mount and climb over, c. acc., Xen.
to project, beetle over, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ὑπεράκριος
div1.sense: over or upon the heights, οἱ Ὑπεράκριοι, οἱ Διάκριοι, the highlanders or inhabitants of the Attic uplands, opp. to the richer classes of the plains and coasts, Hdt.
τὰ ὑπ. the heights above the plain, the uplands, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπέρακρος
div1.sense: over or on the top: adv., ὑπεράκρως ζῆν to carry everything to excess, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπεραλγέω
div1.sense: to feel pain for or because of, τινός Soph., Eur.
to grieve exceedingly, τινί at a thing, Hdt., Arist.:—absol., Eur.

div1.head: ὑπεραλγής
div1.sense: exceeding grievous, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπεραλκής
div1.sense: exceeding strong, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεράλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to leap over or beyond, c. gen., Il.; also c. acc., Il.; so Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέραλλος
div1.sense: above others, exceeding great, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπεράλπειος
div1.sense: transalpine, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπεραναιδεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be surpassed in impudence, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπεραναίσχυντος
div1.sense: exceeding impudent, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερανατείνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to exert oneself excessively, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπεράνθρωπος
div1.sense: superhuman, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερανίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass., with aor2 and perf. act. to stand up or project beyond, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπεραντλέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be very leaky, ὑπ. ἅλμῃ to be water-logged, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπέραντλος
div1.sense: of a ship, quite full of water (ἄντλος) , water-logged, Plut.:—metaph. overcharged, ὑπέραντλος συμφορᾷ Eur.; ταῖς φροντίσιν Plut.

div1.head: ὑπεράνω
div1.sense: over, above, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπεραπατάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be deceived excessively, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπεραποθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die for, τινός Xen.; ὑπέρ τινος Plat.

div1.head: ὑπεραποκρίνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to answer for one, defend him, τινος Ar.

div1.head: ὑπεραπολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep., with fut. and aor1 mid. to speak in behalf of, defend, τινος Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ὑπεραρρωδέω
div1.sense: to be exceeding afraid, τῇ Ἑλλάδι for Hellas, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπέρα
div1.sense: an upper rope: pl. ὑπέραι, the braces attached to the ends of the sailyards (ἐπίκρια) , by means of which the sails are shifted fore and aft, to catch the wind, Od.

div1.head: ὑπερασθενής
div1.sense: exceeding weak, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπέρασθμος
div1.sense: panting exceedingly, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερασπάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be exceeding fond of, τινα Xen.

div1.head: ὑπεράτοπος
div1.sense: beyond measure, absurd, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπεραττικός
div1.sense: carrying the use of the Attic dialect to excess, Luc.: adv. -κῶς, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπεραυγής
div1.sense: shining exceedingly, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπεραυξάνω
div1.sense: to increase above measure:—Pass. to be so increased, Andoc.
intr. to increase exceedingly, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπεραυχέω
div1.sense: to be overproud, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπέραυχος
div1.sense: over-boastful, overproud, Soph., Xen.; ὑπέραυχα βάζειν Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπεραχθής
div1.sense: overburdened, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑπεράχθομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be exceedingly grieved at a thing, c. dat., Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερβαίνω
div1.sense: to step over, mount, scale, c. acc., ὑπ. τεῖχος Il., etc.; ὑπ. δόμους to step over the threshold of the house, Eur.; ὑπ. τοὺς οὔρους to cross the boundaries, Hdt.:—of rivers, to go over their banks, overflow, Hdt.
to overstep, transgress, τοὺς νόμους Hdt., Soph.; τοὺς ὅρκους Dem.: absol. to transgress, trespass, sin, ὅτε κέν τις ὑπερβήῃ (Epic aor2 subj.) Il.
to pass over, pass by, leave out, omit, Hdt., Dem.
to go beyond, to surpass, outdo, c. acc., Plat.; absol., Theogn.
Causal in aor1, to put over, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερβαλλόντως
div1.sense: exceedingly, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπερβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw over or beyond a mark, to overshoot, c. acc., Il.
ὅτε μέλλοι ἄκρον λόφον ὑπερβαλέειν when he was just about to force the stone over the top, Od.
intr. to run beyond, overrun the scent, of hounds, Xen.
to outstrip or pass, τινάς Soph.
metaph.:
to overshoot, outdo, surpass, prevail over, c. gen., βροντῆς ὑπερβάλλοντα κτύπον Aesch.; also c. acc., ὑπ. τινά τινι to outdo one in a thing, Eur.
to go beyond, exceed, c. acc., Hes., etc.; ὑπ. ἑκατὸν ἔτεα to exceed 100 years, in age, Hdt.; ὑπ. τὸν χρόνον, i. e. be too late, Xen.:—also c. gen., Plat.

absol. to exceed all bounds, Aesch., Eur., etc.; οὐχ ὑπερβαλών keeping within bounds, Pind.: to be in excess, Arist.:—often in part., ὑπερβάλλων, ουσα, ον, exceeding, excessive, Aesch., Plat.; τὰ ὑπερβάλλοντα an over-high estate, Eur.; τὸ ὑπ. αὐτῶν such part of them as is extraordinary, Thuc.
to go on further and further, προέβαινε ὑπερβάλλων he went on bidding more and more, Hdt.; ᾔτει τοσαῦτα ὑπερβάλλων Thuc.
to pass over, cross mountains, rivers, etc., c. acc., Aesch., Eur.; also c. gen., Eur.:—of ships, to double a headland, c. acc., Hdt., Thuc.:—absol. to cross over, Hdt., Xen.
of water, to run over, overflow, c. acc., Hdt.
of the Sun, to be at its height or its utmost heat, Hdt.
Mid., with perf. pass., = A. II, to outdo, overcome, conquer, τινα Hdt., Soph., etc.:—absol. to be conqueror, to conquer, Hdt.
to exceed, surpass, τινα Hdt., Ar., etc.:—absol. to exceed, Hdt.:—perf. pass. part., ὑπερβεβλημένη γυνή an excellent, surpassing woman, Eur.
to overbid, outbid, τινα Xen.
to put off, postpone, Hdt.;—but, ἢν ὑπερβάλωνται κείνην τὴν ἡμέραν συμβολὴν μὴ ποιεύμενοι if they let that day pass without fighting, Hdt.:— absol. to delay, linger, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπερβαρής
div1.sense: exceeding heavy, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερβασία
div1.sense: a transgression of law, trespass, Hom., Soph.: also in pl., Il.

div1.head: ὑπέρβασις
div1.sense: transgression, Theogn.

div1.head: ὑπερβατός
div1.sense: to bepassed or crossed, scaleable, of a wall, Thuc.
transposed, of words, Plat.
act. going beyond, τῶνδʼ ὑπερβατώτερα going far beyond these, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερβεβλημένως
div1.sense: beyond all measure, immoderately, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπερβιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to press exceeding heavily, of the plague, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπερβιβάζω
div1.sense: to carry over, c. dupl. acc., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπέρβιος
div1.sense: of overwhelming strength or might, Pind.
in bad sense, overweening, lawless, wanton, Hom.:—neut. ὑπέρβιον as adv., Il.

div1.head: ὑπερβολάδην
div1.sense: immoderately, excessively, Theogn.

div1.head: ὑπερβολή
div1.sense: a throwing beyond others: an overshooting, superiority, Thuc.

excess, over-great degree of a thing, Plat.; in various phrases, χρημάτων ὑπερβολῇ πρίασθαι to buy at an extravagant price, Eur.; οὐκ ἔχει ὑπερβολήν it can go no further, Dem.; εἴ τις ὑπ. τούτου if thereʼs aught beyond (worse than) this, Dem.; ὑπερβολὴν ποιεῖσθαι to go to all extremities, to put an extreme case, Dem.; foll. by a gen., ὑπ. ποιεῖσθαι ἐκείνων τῆς αὑτοῦ βδελυρίας to carry his own rascality beyond theirs, Dem.; ἐπέφερον τὴν ὑπ. τοῦ καινοῦσθαι pushed on their extravagance in revolutionising, Thuc.

with a prep. in Adverbial sense, = ὑπερβαλλόντως, εἰς ὑπερβολήν in excess, exceedingly; c. gen. far beyond, τοῦ πρόσθεν εἰς ὑπ. πανοῦργος, i. e. far more wicked, Eur.:— καθʼ ὑπερβολὴν τοξεύσας with surpassing aim, Soph.; καθ. ὑπ. extravagantly, Isocr., etc.
overstrained phrase, hyperbole, Isocr., Arist.
a crossing over mountains, Xen.
(from Mid.) a deferring, delay, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: Ὑπερβόρεοι
div1.sense: the Hyperboreans, an imaginary people in the extreme north, distinguished for piety and happiness, Pind., Hdt.;— τύχη ὑπερβόρεος, proverb. of more than mortal fortune, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερβράζω
div1.sense: to boil or foam over, in aor. pass., Anth.

div1.head: ὑπερβρύω
div1.sense: to be overfull, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to work under, plough up, prepare for sowing, Xen.
to subdue, reduce: perf. in pass. sense, to be subdued, Eur.
to do underhand or secretly, Plut.
= ὑπηρετέω, to do a service: perf. in pass. sense, πόλλʼ ὑπείργασται φίλα many kind acts have been done, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπεργέλοιος
div1.sense: above measure ridiculous, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπεργεμίζω
div1.sense: to overfill, overload, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέργηρως
div1.sense: exceeding old, of extreme age, Luc.: τὸ ὑπέργηρων extreme old age, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπέρδασυς
div1.sense: very hairy, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερδεής
div1.sense: above all fear, undaunted, Il.

div1.head: ὑπερδείδω
div1.sense: to fear for one, c. gen., Aesch., Soph.: absol. to be in exceeding fear, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπερδειμαίνω
div1.sense: to be much afraid of, τινά Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπέρδεινος
div1.sense: exceeding alarming, Dem., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερδέξιος
div1.sense: lying above one on the right hand, Xen.:—simply, lying above, ὑπ. χωρίον higher ground, Xen.; τὰ ὑπερδέξια Xen.; ἐξ ὑπερδεξίου from above, Xen.: —c. gen. commanding from above, Polyb.
metaph. having the advantage in a thing, Polyb.: victorious over, τινος Plut.

div1.head: ὑπερδέω
div1.sense: to bind over, τί τινι Anth.

div1.head: ὑπερδιατείνω
div1.sense: Mid. to exert oneself above measure, Dem., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερδικέω
div1.sense: to plead for, act as advocate for, τινός Plat.; ὑπ. τὸ φεύγειν τινός to advocate his acquittal, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπέρδικος
div1.sense: more than just, severely just, Pind.; κἂν ὑπέρδικʼ ᾖ be they never so just, Soph.; adv. -κως, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερεθίζω
div1.sense: to stimulate a little, Babr.

div1.head: ὑπερείδω
div1.sense: to put under as a support, Pind., Plat.
to under-prop, support, Plut.

div1.head: Ὑπερείη
div1.sense: high-land, of the Phaeacians, Od.

div1.head: ὑπερείπω
div1.sense: to subvert:—Pass., Plut.
intr. in aor2 ὑπήριπον, to tumble, fall down, Il.

div1.head: ὑπερέκεινα
div1.sense: on yon side, beyond, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερεκθεραπεύω
div1.sense: to seek to win by excessive attention, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπερεκπερισσοῦ
div1.sense: super-abundantly, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερεκπίπτω
div1.sense: to go beyond all bounds, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερεκπλήσσω
div1.sense: to frighten beyond measure:— Pass. to be in amazement, Xen.; ὑπερεκπεπληγμένος Φίλιππον admiring him exceedingly, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερεκτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch beyond measure, ἑαυτόν NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερεκτίνω
div1.sense: to pay for any one, τινός Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερεκχύνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to run over, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερέλαφρος
div1.sense: exceeding light or nimble, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερεμπίπλημι
div1.sense: to fill over-full:—Pass. to be overfull, τινος of a thing, Xen., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερεμφορέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be filled quite full, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερεντυγχάνω
div1.sense: to intercede, ὑπέρ τινος for one, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερεξακισχίλιοι
div1.sense: above 6000, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερεπαινέω
div1.sense: to praise above measure, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερεπιθυμέω
div1.sense: to desire exceedingly, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερέπτω
div1.sense: to eat away from under, κονίην ὑπέρεπτε ποδοῖιν Il.

div1.head: ὑπερέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor2 and perf. act.:— to pass over a river, c. acc., Xen.
to surpass, excel, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπερεσθίω
div1.sense: to eat immoderately, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερευγενής
div1.sense: exceeding noble, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπερευδαιμονέω
div1.sense: to be exceeding happy, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπερευφραίνω
div1.sense: Mid. to rejoice exceedingly, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερεχθαίρω
div1.sense: to hate exceedingly, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερέχω
div1.sense: to hold one thing over another, τί τινος Il., Ar.; ὑπ. χεῖρά τινος to hold the hand over him, so as to protect, Il., Theogn.; also c. dat. pers., Hom.
to have or hold above, ὑπείρεχεν εὐρέας ὤμους he had his broad shoulders above the rest, i. e. over-topped them by the head and shoulders, Il.

intr. to be above, rise above the horizon, Od.: to be above water or the ground, Hdt.;—c. gen., ὑπερέσχεθε γαίης rose above, overlooked the earth, Il.; σταυροὺς οὐχ ὑπερέχοντας τῆς θαλάσσης Thuc., etc.
in military phrase, to outflank, c. gen., Xen.
metaph. to overtop, exceed, outdo, c. acc., Aesch., Eur.:—also c. gen., Plat., etc.
absol. to overtop the rest, be prominent, Hdt., Xen.: to prevail, οἱ ὑπερσχόντες the more powerful, Aesch.; ἐὰν ἡ θάλαττα ὑπέρσχῃ to be too powerful, Dem.
c. gen. rei, to rise above, Ar.
c. acc. to get over, cross, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπερζέω
div1.sense: to boil over: metaph., of a man, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερήδομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be overjoyed at, τινι Hdt.; c. part., ὑπερήδετο ἀκούων he rejoiced much at hearing, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπέρευ
div1.sense: exceeding well, excellently, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ὑπέρηδυς
div1.sense: exceeding sweet, Luc. adv. -έως, Xen.; Sup. -ήδιστα, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερημερία
div1.sense: a being over the day: as law-term, the latest day for payment, Dem.
forfeiture of recognisances, a distress, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερήμερος
div1.sense: over the day for payment, after which the debtor became liable to have his goods seized, Dem.; ὑπερήμερον λαμβάνων τινά, i. e. having a right to distrain upon him, Dem.
metaph., ὑπ. τῆς ζωῆς past the term of life, Luc.; ὑπ. τοῦ βίου beyond the term of human life, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερήμισυς
div1.sense: above half, more than half, Hdt.; τινος of a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέρημος
div1.sense: somewhat desolate, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπερηνορέων
div1.etym: part. with no pres. in use
div1.sense: exceedingly manly:—but always in bad sense, overbearing, overweening, Hom.
in Com. phrase, excelling men, thinking oneself more than man, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερήνωρ
div1.note: ὑπερ-ήνωρ, Doric ὑπερ-ᾱνωρ, ορος, ὁ, ἡ,
div1.sense: overbearing, overweening, Hes., Eur.

div1.head: ὑπερηφανέω
div1.note: used by Hom. only in part.
div1.sense: much like ὑπερηνορέων overweening, arrogant, Il.
trans. to treat disdainfully, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερηφανία
div1.sense: arrogance, disdain, Xen., Dem.:—c. gen. objecti, contempt towards or for another, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερήφανος
div1.etym: prob. for ὑπερφανής, η being inserted.
div1.sense: in bad sense, overweening, arrogant, haughty, Hes., Aesch., Dem.; οἰκίαι ὑπερηφανώτεραι Dem.;—so in adv., ὑπερηφάνως ἔχειν to bear oneself haughtily, Plat.; ὑπ. ζῆν to live prodigally, Isocr.
in good sense, magnificent, splendid, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπερθαλασσίδιος
div1.sense: above the coast-land, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπερθαυμάζω
div1.sense: to wonder exceedingly, Hdt., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερθαύμαστος
div1.sense: most admirable, Anth.

div1.head: ὕπερθεν
div1.sense: from above or merely above, Il.: of the body, above, in the upper parts, opp. to ἔνερθε, Il.
from heaven above, i. e. from the gods, Hom.
of Degree, yet more, Soph.
c. gen. above, over, Pind., Aesch., etc.; ὕπ. γίγνεσθαί τινος to get the better of one, Eur.; also, ὕπερθεν εἶναι ἢ . . , to be above or beyond, i. e. worse than . . , Eur.

div1.head: ὑπέρθεσις
div1.sense: postponement, Polyb.

div1.head: ὑπερθέω
div1.sense: to run beyond, ὑπ. ἄκραν to double the headland, proverb. of escaping from danger, Aesch.
to outstrip, outdo, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ὑπερθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die for another, c. gen. or absol., Eur.

div1.head: ὑπερθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to overleap, leap or spring over, c. acc., Il., etc.;—also c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ὑπέρθυμος
div1.sense: high-spirited, high-minded, daring, Hom., Hes., etc.
in bad sense, overdaring, overweening, Hes. — overspirited, of a horse, Xen.
vehemently angry:—adv., ὑπερθύμως ἄγαν in over- vehement wrath, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερθύριον
div1.sense: the lintel of a door or gate, Lat. superliminare, Od., Hes.

div1.head: ὑπεριάχω
div1.sense: to shout above, out-shout, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ὑπερίημι
div1.sense: to outdo, Od.

div1.head: ὑπερικταίνομαι
div1.note: Pass., in the phrase, πόδες ὑπερικταίνοντο
div1.sense: the feet went exceeding swiftly, Od.

div1.head: Ὑπεριονίδης
div1.sense: patronym. of Ὑπερίων, Hyperionʼs son, i. e. Ἥλιος, Od., Hes.

div1.head: ὑπερίπταμαι
div1.etym: later form for ὑπερπέτομαι, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass., with aor2 and perf. act.:— to stand over another, c. gen., Hdt.: esp. to stand over one for protection, protect, τινος Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερίστωρ
div1.sense: knowing too well, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερίσχυρος
div1.sense: exceeding strong, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερίσχω
div1.sense: to be above, to prevail over, c. gen., Hes.
to protect, τινός Anth.

div1.head: Ὑπερίων
div1.sense: Hyperion, the Sun-god, joined with Ἥλιος, or alone for Ἥλιος, Hom. Some derive it from ὑπὲρ ἰών, he that walks on high: others simply bring Ὑπερίων from ὑπέρ, the God above.

div1.head: ὑπερκάθημαι
div1.sense: to sit over or upon, ἐπί τινος Xen.:—metaph. to sit over and watch, keep an eye on, τινος Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέρκαλος
div1.sense: exceeding beautiful, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπερκάμνω
div1.sense: to suffer or labour for, τινός Eur.

div1.head: ὑπερκαταβαίνω
div1.sense: to get down over, get quite over, c. acc., Il.; c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ὑπερκαταγέλαστος
div1.sense: exceedingly absurd, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπερκατάκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie or sit above, at table, c. gen., Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερκατηφής
div1.sense: very distressing, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερκαχλάζω
div1.sense: to run bubbling over, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπέρκειμαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to lie or be situate above, Isocr.
to be postponed, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερκενόω
div1.sense: Pass. to be quite empty, Galen.

div1.head: ὑπερκέρασις
div1.sense: an outflanking on one wing, Polyb.

div1.head: ὑπερκλύζω
div1.sense: to overflow, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπερκολακεύω
div1.sense: to flatter immoderately, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry over, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπέρκομπος
div1.sense: overweening, arrogant, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπέρκοπος
div1.sense: overstepping all bounds, extravagant, arrogant, Aesch., Soph.:—adv. -πως, excessively, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερκορέννυμι
div1.sense: to over-fill or glut, τινά τινος one with a thing, Theogn.

div1.head: ὑπέρκοτος
div1.sense: exceeding angry, cruel, Aesch.:— adv. -τως, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπερκρεμάννυμι
div1.sense: to hang up over, ὑπ. ἄτην τινί Pind.:—Pass. to impend, Theogn.

div1.head: ὑπερκτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to acquire over and above, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερκύδας
div1.sense: exceeding famous or renowned, only in acc., ὑπερκύδαντας Ἀχαιούς Il.; ὑπερκύδαντα Μενοίτιον Hes.

div1.head: ὑπερκύπτω
div1.sense: to stretch and peep over, Plat.; c. gen., Luc.
to step beyond, overstep, c. acc., Anth.

div1.head: ὑπέρλαμπρος
div1.sense: exceeding bright, Ar.
of sound, very clear or loud, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερλαμπρύνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to make a splendid show: to shew great eagerness, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερλίαν
div1.sense: exceedingly, beyond all doubt, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερλυπέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be vexed beyond measure, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπερμαζάω
div1.sense: to be overfull of barley bread (μᾶζα) , to be wanton from high feeding, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερμαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be or go stark mad, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερμαχέω
div1.sense: to fight for or on behalf of, τινός Soph., Eur.; σὺ ταῦτα τοῦδʼ ὑπερμαχεῖς ἐμοί; dost thou fight thus for him against me? Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερμαχητικός
div1.sense: inclined to fight for, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπερμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. = ὑπερμαχέω, Plut.; τάδʼ πατρὸς ὑπερμαχοῦμαι will fight this battle for him, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπέρμαχος
div1.sense: a champion, defender, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπέρμεγας
div1.sense: immensely great, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερμεθύσκομαι
div1.sense: Pass.:— to get (and in aor. to be) excessively drunk, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπερμενέων
div1.sense: part. with no pres. in use, exceeding mighty, Od.

div1.head: ὑπερμενής
div1.sense: exceeding mighty, exceeding strong, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ὑπέρμετρος
div1.sense: beyond all measure, excessive, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπερμήκης
div1.sense: exceeding long, Aesch.; ἡ βασιλέος χεὶρ ὑπ. the kingʼs arm is very long, reaches very far, Hdt.
exceeding high, of mountains, Hdt.
ὑπερμάκης βοά a cry exceeding loud, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπέρμορον
div1.sense: ὑπὲρ μόρον.

div1.head: ὑπερνέφελος
div1.sense: above the clouds, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερνεωλκέω
div1.sense: to haul ships over land, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπερνικάω
div1.sense: to be more than conqueror, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερνότιος
div1.sense: beyond the south wind, i. e. at the extreme south, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπέρογκος
div1.sense: of excessive bulk, swollen to a great size, Xen., Dem.
immoderate, excessive, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπεροιδαίνω
div1.sense: to be much swollen, of a river, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπεροικέω
div1.sense: to dwell above or beyond, c.gen., Hdt.; also c. acc., Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπέροικος
div1.sense: dwelling above or beyond, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπεροπλία
div1.sense: overweening confidence in arms, proud defiance, presumptuousness, ὑπεροπλί_ῃσι [Epic dat. pl., with ῑ], Il.

div1.head: ὑπεροπλίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to vanquish by force of arms, or (from ὑπέροπλος to treat scornfully, Od.

div1.head: ὑπέροπλος
div1.sense: proudly trusting in force of arms, defiant, presumptuous, ὑπέροπλον εἰπεῖν (as adv.) to speak defiantly, presumptuously, Il.; ἠνορέη, βίη ὑπέροπλος Hes.
of conditions, excessive, overwhelming, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπερόπτης
div1.sense: a contemner, disdainer of a thing, c. gen., Soph., Thuc.: absol. disdainful, haughty, Theocr., Arist.

div1.head: ὑπεροπτικός
div1.sense: disposed to despise others, contemptuous, disdainful, Isocr., Dem.:—adv. -κῶς, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέροπτος
div1.sense: disdainful, Anth.; neut. pl. as adv., Soph.

div1.head: ὑπεροράω
div1.sense: to look over, look down upon, c. acc., Hdt.
to overlook, slight, despise, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—also c. gen. to shew contempt for, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερορίζω
div1.sense: to drive beyond the frontier, banish, Plat.; in Pass., Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπερόριος
div1.sense: over the boundaries or confines, living abroad, Dem., Theocr.; ὑπ. ἀσχολία occupation in foreign parts, Thuc.; τὰ ὑπ. foreign affairs, Arist.
ἡ ὑπερορία (sc. γῆ) , the country beyond oneʼs own frontiers, a foreign country, Plat., Xen.
foreign to the purpose, outlandish, out-of-the-way, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπερόρνυμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to rise and hang over, c. dat., Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερορρωδέω
div1.sense: to be much afraid, τινός for one, Eur.

div1.head: ὕπερος
div1.sense: a pestle to bray and pound with, Hes., Hdt.
anything shaped like a pestle, a club, cudgel, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερουράνιος
div1.sense: above the heavens, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπεροχή
div1.sense: a projection, an eminence, Polyb.
metaph. preeminence, superiority, ἡ δὲ νίκη ὑπεροχή τις Arist.

div1.head: ὑπέροχος
div1.sense: prominent, eminent, distinguished above others, c. gen., Il.; absol., Hdt.; ὑπέροχος βία overbearing force, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπεροψία
div1.sense: contempt, disdain for a person or thing, c. gen., Thuc., etc.: absol. haughtiness, arrogance, Isocr.

div1.head: ὑπερπαγής
div1.sense: very frosty: τὸ ὑπ. excessive frost, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερπαθέω
div1.sense: to be grievously distressed, ὑπερπαθήσασʼ Eur.

div1.head: ὑπερπαίω
div1.sense: to overstrike, i. e. to surpass, exceed, c. gen., Ar.; c. acc., Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερπαλύνω
div1.sense: to strew or scatter over, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπερπερισσεύω
div1.sense: Mid. to abound more and more, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπέρ

trans.i: over, above, w. gen, over, beyond, w. acc.

div1.sense: Lat. super:—hence are formed comp. and Sup. ὑπέρτερος, -τατος.
WITH GENIT.,
of Place, over, above:
in a state of rest, στέρνον ὑπὲρ μαζοῖο Il.; ὑπὲρ κεφαλῆς στῆναί τινι to stand over his head, Hom.: of countries, above, further inland, οἰκέοντες ὑπὲρ Ἁλικαρνησσοῦ μεσόγαιαν Hdt.
in a state of motion, over, across, ὑπὲρ θαλάσσης καὶ χθονὸς ποτωμένοις Aesch.
over, beyond, ὑπὲρ πόντου Od.

metaph., from the notion of standing over to protect, for, for defence of, in behalf of, ἑκατόμβην ῥέξαι ὑπὲρ Δαναῶν Il.; θύειν ὑπὲρ τῆς πόλεως Xen.; ὑπὲρ τῆς πατρίδος ἀμύνειν to fight for oneʼs country, etc.
for the sake of a person or thing, λίσσεσθαι ὑπὲρ τοκέων, ὑ. πατρὸς καὶ μητρός Il.
c. inf. for the purpose of, ὑπὲρ τοῦ μηδένα ἀποθνήσκειν to prevent any one from dying, Xen.
for, instead of, in the name of, ὑπὲρ ἑαυτοῦ Thuc.; στρατηγῶν ὑπὲρ ὑμῶν acting as general by commission from you, Dem.
like περί, on, of, concerning, Lat. de, ὑπὲρ σέθεν αἴσχεα ἀκούω Il.; τὰ λεγόμενα ὑπέρ τινος Hdt.
WITH ACC., expressing that over and beyond which a thing goes,
of Place, over, beyond, Hom., Plat.
of Measure, over, above, exceeding, beyond, ὑπὲρ τὸ βέλτιστον Aesch.; ὑπὲρ ἐλπίδα Soph., etc.
of transgression, beyond, contrary to, ὑπὲρ αἶσαν, ὑπὲρ μοῖραν, ὑπὲρ ὅρκια Il.
of Number, above, upwards of, ὑπὲρ τεσσεράκοντα Hdt., Xen.; ὑπὲρ τὸ ἥμισυ more than half, Xen.
of Time, beyond, i. e. before, earlier than, ὁ ὑπὲρ τὰ Μηδικὰ πόλεμος Thuc.
POSITION: ὑπέρ may follow its Subst., but then by anastrophe becomes ὕπερ, Hom., Trag.
AS ADV. over much, above measure, ὑπὲρ μὲν ἄγαν Eur.; written ὑπεράγαν, Strab., etc.
IN COMPOS.,
of Place, over, beyond, in ὑπερ-βαίνω, ὑπερ-πόντιος.
for, in defence of, in ὑπερ-ασπίζω, ὑπερ-αλγέω.
above measure, in ὑπερ-ήφανος, ὑπερ-φίαλος.

div1.head: ὑπερπερισσῶς
div1.sense: beyond all measure, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερπετάννυμι
div1.sense: to stretch over, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερπετής
div1.sense: flying over or above, Strab.:—metaph. high-flying, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερπέτομαι
div1.sense: to fly over, of a spear, Hom.
c. acc. to fly over or beyond, Od.; also c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: ὑπερπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap over, c. acc., Ar.
metaph. to overleap, transgress, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπέρπικρος
div1.sense: exceeding sharp in temper, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to overfill: Pass., aor1 ὑπερεπλήσθην, to be overfull, Arist.;—c. gen., ὑπερπλησθεὶς μέθης Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερπίνω
div1.sense: to drink overmuch, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall over, run over, project, Strab.
of Time, to be past, gone by, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπερπλεονάζω
div1.sense: to abound exceedingly, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερπληθής
div1.sense: superabundant, ὑπερπλήθη ἐξημαρτηκώς having done more misdeeds than enough, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπερπληρόω
div1.sense: to fill overfull, Xen.:—Pass. to be overfull, to be gorged, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερπλούσιος
div1.sense: over-wealthy, exceeding rich, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπερπλουτέω
div1.sense: to be exceeding rich, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερπολάζω
div1.sense: to overflow, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπέρπολυς
div1.sense: overmuch, in pl. over many, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερπονέω
div1.sense: to labour beyond measure, take further trouble, Xen.
to bear or endure for others, Soph.
in Mid. c. gen. pers., Soph.

div1.head: ὑπέρπονος
div1.sense: quite worn out, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπερπόντιος
div1.sense: over the sea, Aesch.; φοιτᾷς ὑπερπόντιος Soph.
from beyond the sea, i. e. foreign, strange, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπέρπτωχος
div1.sense: exceeding poor, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπερπυππάζω
div1.sense: to make very much of one, to fondle and caress him, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερπυρριάω
div1.sense: to blush scarlet for another, c. gen., Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερσεμνύνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to be exceeding solemn or pompous, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέρσοφος
div1.sense: exceeding wise or clever, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπερσπουδάζω
div1.sense: to take exceeding great pains, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπέρτατος
div1.sense: uppermost, highest, supreme, Il., etc.
of age, eldest, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπερτείνω
div1.sense: trans. to stretch or lay over, Hdt.: to hold out over to, τί τινι Eur.; ὑπ. σκιὰν σειρίου κυνός to stretch over [the house] a shade from the sun, Aesch.; ὑπ. χεῖρά τινος to stretch the hand over one for protection, Eur.; ὑπ. πόδα ἀκτῆς to stretch oneʼs foot over the beach, i. e. pass over it, Eur.
to strain to the uttermost, Plut.
intr. to stretch or jut out over, Thuc.:—also c. acc., ὑπ. τὸ κέρας to outflank the enemyʼs wing, Xen.
metaph. to exceed the measure or number of, c. gen., Dem.;— c. acc. to exceed, τὴν ἀνθρωπίνην φύσιν Arist.

div1.head: ὑπερτελέω
div1.sense: to overleap, c. acc., Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερτελής
div1.sense: leaping over the strait, Aesch.
c. gen. rising or appearing above, Eur.; ἄθλων ὑπερτελής having reached the end of labours, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερτέλλω
div1.sense: to appear above, ὑπερτείλας ὁ ἥλιος the sun when he is well above the horizon, Hdt.; ὑπ. ἐκ γαίας to start from the ground, Eur.; c. gen., φαρέων μαστὸς ὑπερτέλλων appearing above her dress, Eur.; κορυφῆς ὑπερτέλλων πέτρος hanging over the head [of Tantalus], Eur.

div1.head: ὑπερτενής
div1.sense: stretching over, laid over, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπερτερία
div1.sense: the upper part or body of a carriage, Od.

div1.head: ὑπέρτερος
div1.sense: over or above, upper, κρέα ὑπέρτερα flesh from the outer parts of a victim, opp. to the σπλάγχνα or inwards, Od.
metaph. higher, nobler, more excellent, Il.: stronger, mightier, Soph.
c. gen. victorious or triumphant over, Pind., Eur.; οὐδὲν οἶδʼ ὑπέρτερον I know nothing further, more certain, Soph.
neut. as adv., better than, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερτήκω
div1.sense: to melt exceedingly, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπερτίθημι
div1.sense: to set higher, erect, Anth.
to set on the other side, carry over, Plut.
in Mid. to hold over, so as to protect, Anth.
metaph., παντὶ θεὸν ὑπερτιθέμεν to set God over all, Pind.
to communicate a thing to another, ὑπερετίθεα (Ionic imperf. for -ετίθην) τὰ ἔμελλον ποιήσειν Hdt.:—so in Mid., esp. in order to ask advice, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπερτιμάω
div1.sense: to honour exceedingly, τινά Soph.

div1.head: ὑπέρτονος
div1.sense: overstrained, strained to the utmost, at full pitch, exceeding loud, Aesch., Ar.

div1.head: ὑπερτρέχω
div1.sense: to run over or beyond, outrun, escape, c. acc., Theogn., Eur.
to excel, surpass, τινά Eur.: absol. to prevail, Eur.
to overstep, transgress a law, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερυθριάω
div1.sense: to blush a little, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπέρυθρος
div1.sense: somewhat red, reddish, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπερύψηλος
div1.sense: exceeding high, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερυψόω
div1.sense: to exalt exceedingly, τινά NTest.

div1.head: ὑπερφαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to shew oneself over or above a place, c. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπερφαλαγγέω
div1.sense: to extend the phalanx so as to outflank the enemy: generally, to outflank, Xen.; c. gen., ὑπ. τοῦ στρατεύματος Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερφανής
div1.sense: appearing over or above, out-topping others, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέρφατος
div1.sense: above speech, unspeakable, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπερφέρω
div1.sense: to bear or carry over a place, ὑπ. τὸν ἰσθμὸν τὰς ναῦς Thuc.:—Pass., αἱ ναῦς αἱ ὑπερενεχθεῖσαι τὸν ἰσθμόν Thuc.

intr. to rise above, to surpass, excel, have the advantage over, τινός τινι one in a thing, Hdt., Ar.; also c. acc. pro gen., ὑπερφέρεις τόλμῃ τόλμαν Eur.: absol. to excel, have preeminence, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ὑπερφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sound above, τὰ ἔργα ὑπ. τοὺς λόγους Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερφθίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to die for or in behalf of, ὑπερέφθιτο (poet. aor2) πατρός Pind.

div1.head: ὑπερφίαλος
div1.sense: overbearing, overweening, arrogant, Hom.:—adv. -λως, exceedingly, Hom.: arrogantly, Od.
div1.etym: Deriv. uncertain: perh. an Epic form either of ὑπέρβιος or of ὑπερφυής.

div1.head: ὑπερφιλέω
div1.sense: to love beyond measure, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερφοβέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. with fut. mid., to be overfrightened, fear exceedingly, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέρφοβος
div1.sense: very fearful, timid, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερφορέω
div1.sense: to carry over, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερφρονέω
div1.sense: to be over-proud, to have high thoughts, Aesch.; ὑπ. τινί to be proud in or of a thing, Hdt., Plat.
c. acc. to look down upon, despise, Aesch., Ar.:—Pass. to be despised, Thuc.
c. gen. to think slightly of, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ὑπέρφρων
div1.sense: over-proud, haughty, disdainful, arrogant, Aesch., Eur.: neut. pl. ὑπέρφρονα as adv., Soph.
in good sense, ἐκ τοῦ ὑπέρφρονος from a sense of superiority, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπερφυής
div1.sense: overgrown, enormous, Hdt., Ar.
monstrous, marvellous, extraordinary, Hdt., Ar.:—joined with a relat., ὑπερφυὴς ὅσος extraordinary how great, i. e. extraordinarily great, Ar., Plat.
adv. -ῶς, over-much, marvellously, strangely, exceedingly, Ar., Plat.; in affirm. answers, ὑπερφυῶς μὲν οὖν Plat.

div1.head: ὑπερφύομαι
div1.sense: Pass., with aor2 and perf. act., to surpass, excel, c. acc., Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπερφυσάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be inflated excessively, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερφωνέω
div1.sense: to outbawl, τινά Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερχαίρω
div1.sense: to rejoice exceedingly at a thing c. dat., Eur.; c. part., μανθάνων ὑπ. Xen.

div1.head: ὑπερχλίω
div1.sense: to be over-wanton or arrogant, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor2 and perf. act.:— to go or come under, enter, Lat. subire, c. acc., Od., Aesch.
of involuntary feelings, to come upon, steal over one, c. acc., Τρῶας τρόμος ὑπήλυθε Il.; ὑπῆλθέ με φόβος Soph., etc.
of persons, to creep into anotherʼs good graces, to fawn on, cringe to, c. acc., Ar., Plat.
to undermine, beguile, Soph., Eur.
to advance slowly, of an army, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπέρχρεως
div1.sense: over head and ears in debt, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπέρψυχρος
div1.sense: very frigid, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπερωέω
div1.sense: to start back, recoil, Il.

div1.head: ὑπερῴη
div1.sense: the upper part of the mouth, the palate, Il.

div1.head: ὑπερωϊόθεν
div1.sense: from an upper room, Od.

div1.head: ὑπερῷον
div1.sense: the upper part of the house, the upper story or upper rooms, where the women resided, Hom.:—in Attic, an Attic, garret, Ar. (v. ὑπερῷος).

div1.head: ὑπερῷος
div1.sense: being above, Plut.
div1.etym: From ὑπέρ; -ῷος being a term., as πατρῴος, μητρῴος from πατήρ, μήτηρ.

div1.head: ὑπερωτάω
div1.sense: to reply by a question, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπεύθυνος
div1.sense: liable to give account for oneʼs administration of an office, accountable, responsible, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:— ὑπεύθυνοι, οἱ, at Athens, magistrates who had to submit their accounts to public auditors (λογισταί) , Ar., etc.
c. gen. responsible for, ὑπ. ἀρχῆς ἑτέρας ap. Dem.; of slaves, σῶμα ὑπ. ἀδικημάτων their body is liable for their misdeeds, i. e. they must pay for them with their body, Dem.
c. dat. responsible to another, dependent on them, Lat. obnoxius, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπέχω
div1.sense: to hold or put under, ὑποσχὼν θηλέας ἵππους (cf. Virgil supposita de matre), Il.: to hold out the hand to receive something, Il., Dem.: to hold a cup under another vessel, while something is poured into it, Hdt., Ar.; ὑπ. μαστόν, of the mother giving suck, Eur.
to supply, afford, furnish, Pind.; ὑπ. τινί φόβον to occasion him fear, Thuc.:— ὑπ. ἑαυτόν submit oneself to another, Xen., Plat.
to uphold, support, c. acc., Hdt.

Lat. sustinere, to undergo, be subject to, suffer, Soph., Eur.; ὑπ. δίκην τινός to have to give an account of a thing, Hdt., Attic; ὑπ. δίκην to undergo a trial, Thuc.; ὑπ. λόγον τινί to render account to another, Plat., Xen., etc.
to sustain, maintain, λόγον an argument, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπήκοος
div1.sense: giving ear, listening to, τινι Anth.
obedient, subject to another, c. gen., Hdt., Aesch., etc.; so, c. dat., Eur., Xen.
c. dat. rei, ναυσὶν ὑπ. liable to furnish ships, Thuc.
absol. as Subst., ὑπήκοοι, οἱ, subjects, Thuc., etc.; ἡ ὑπήκοος (sc. χώρα) ; τὸ ὑπήκοον = οἱ ὑπ., Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπηνέμιος
div1.sense: lifted or wafted by the wind, Theocr.
full of wind, ὑπ. ᾠόν a wind-egg, which produces no chicken, Ar.:— metaph. vain, idle, empty, Luc.; of men, braggart, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπήνεμος
div1.sense: under the wind, under shelter from it, Soph., Theocr.; ἐκ τοῦ ὑπηνέμου on the lee-side, Xen.: metaph. gentle, Eur.
swift as the wind, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπήνη
div1.sense: the hair on the under part of the face, the beard, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπηνήτης
div1.sense: one that is just getting a beard, with oneʼs first beard, Hom., Plat.:—generally bearded, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπηοῖος
div1.sense: about dawn, towards morning, early, Hom.; στίβη ὑπηοίη morning frost, Od.

div1.head: ὑπηρεσία
div1.sense: the body of rowers and sailors, the shipʼs crew, Thuc., etc.
service, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ὑπηρέσιον
div1.sense: the cushion on a rowerʼs bench, Thuc.
= ὑπηρετικὸν πλοῖον, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπηρετέω
div1.sense: to do service on board ship, to do rowerʼs service:— hence to be a servant, do service, serve, Soph., Ar.

c. dat. to minister to, serve, Lat. inservire, Hdt., Attic; ὑπ. τοῖς τρόποις to comply with, humour his ways, Ar.; ὑπ. τῶι λόγωι to second, support it, Eur.: — ὑπ. τινί τι to help one in a thing, Soph., Ar., etc.
absol. to serve, lend aid, Soph.:—Pass. to be done as service, Hdt., Isocr.

div1.head: ὑπηρέτημα
div1.sense: service rendered, service, Plat.; ποδῶν ὑπ. feet that serve one, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπηρέτησις
div1.sense: service, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπηρέτης
div1.sense: properly an under-rower, under-seaman, v. ὑπηρεσία.
generally an underling, servant, attendant, assistant, Lat. apparitor, Hdt., Attic:—c. gen. objecti, ὑπ. ἔργου a helper in a work, Xen.
at Athens,
the servant who attended each man-at-arms (ὁπλίτης) to carry his baggage and shield, Thuc.
ὁ τῶν ἕνδεκα ὑπ. the assistant of the Eleven, employed in executions, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπηρετητέος
div1.sense: one must serve, τινί Arist.

div1.head: ὑπηρετικός
div1.sense: of or for the ὑπηρέται, menial, Plat.; ὅπλα ὑπ. the arms of the hired soldiery, Xen.
of or for service, doing service, Plat., etc.
subordinate, Arist.
κέλης ὑπ. a cockboat, attending on a larger vessel, Xen.; τὸ ὑπ. (sc. πλοῖον) an attendant vessel, despatch-boat, tender, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπηχέω
div1.sense: to sound under or in answer, to echo, respond, Hes.

div1.head: ὑπίλλω
div1.sense: to force underneath, properly of a dog putting its tail between the legs: metaph., σοὶ ὑπίλλουσι στόμα keep down their tongue before thee, i. e. fawn and cringe before thee, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπισχνέομαι
div1.sense: 3 sg. plup. ὑπέσχητο:— to promise or engage to do a thing, Il., Attic;—in Attic also, sometimes, to take upon oneself, i. e. to undertake to do, to promise a thing, c. acc., Hom.; with inf. aor., Xen.
absol. to promise, make promises, Hdt.
with inf. pres. to profess that one is, profess to be, Hdt., Plat.: also to profess to do a thing, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ὑπνώω
div1.sense: to sleep, Hom.

div1.head: ὑπνίδιος
div1.sense: drowsy, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπνοδότειρα
div1.sense: she that gives sleep, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπνομαχέω
div1.sense: to fight with sleep, withstand sleep, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπνοδότης
div1.sense: giver of sleep, Aesch.

div1.head: ὕπνος
div1.sense: sleep, slumber, Hom., etc.; χάλκεος ὕπνος, i. e. the sleep of death, Il.:— ὕπνος τινὰ ἐπέρχεται, ἐπορούει, ἱκάνει, αἱρεῖ, λαμβάνει Hom., etc.; εἰς ὕπνον πεσεῖν Soph.:— ἐν ὕπνῳ in sleep, Eur.;— καθʼ ὕπνον Soph.;— περὶ πρῶτον ὕπνον about oneʼs first sleep, Ar.
Sleep, twin-brother of Death, Il.

div1.head: ὑπνοφόβης
