div1.sense: scaring in sleep, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπνόω
div1.sense: to put to sleep:— Pass. to fall asleep, sleep, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπνώδης
div1.sense: sleepy, drowsy, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπνώσσω
div1.sense: to be sleepy or drowsy, Aesch., Plat.: simply, to sleep, Eur.

div1.head: ὑποάμουσος
div1.sense: somewhat estranged from the Muses, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόβαθρον
div1.sense: anything put under: a framework to support a couch, a rocking apparatus, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποβαίνω
div1.sense: to go or stand under: metaph., τεσσαράκοντα πόδας ὑποβὰς τῆς ἑτέρης πυραμίδος τωὐτὸ μέγαθος having gone 40 feet below the like size of the other pyramid, i. e. building it 40 feet lower, Hdt.; μικρὸν ὑποβάς, a little below (in the book), Strab.

div1.head: ὑποβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw, put or lay under, Od.; τί τινι Eur.
to lay under, as a foundation, Aeschin.
to subject, submit, ἐχθροῖς ἐμαυτόν Eur.
Mid. to substitute anotherʼs child for oneʼs own, Lat. supponere, Hdt., Plat., etc.
to suggest, whisper, as a prompter does, Il., Plat., etc.: Mid. to make false suggestions, Soph.
in Mid. to appropriate, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποβαρβαρίζω
div1.sense: to speak a little like a foreigner, speak rather broken, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόβασις
div1.sense: a going down: a crouching down, esp. of a horse that lowers itself to take up the rider, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποβένθιος
div1.sense: under the depths, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποβήσσω
div1.sense: to have a slight cough, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποβιβάζω
div1.sense: to bring down: Mid. to crouch down, of a horse that stoops to take up the rider, Lat. subsidere, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποβλέπω
div1.sense: to look up from under the brows at, glance at, to look askance at, eye suspiciously or angrily, Lat. limis oculis suspicere, Plat.; also ὑπ. ἐλεεινά to cast piteous glances, Anth.:—Pass. to be looked at with suspicion, Eur.

div1.head: ὑποβλήδην
div1.sense: adv. throwing in covertly, i. e. by way of caution or reproof, or by way of interruption, Il.
askance, Hhymn.

div1.head: ὑποβλητέος
div1.sense: to be put under, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπόβλητος
div1.sense: put in anotherʼs place, counterfeit, suborned, false, Soph.

div1.head: ὑποβολή
div1.sense: actively, a throwing or laying under, Plat.
a substitution by stealth, esp. of supposititious children, Plat.
a suggesting, ἐξ ὑποβολῆς by admonition, Xen.
the subject-matter of a speech, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποβολιμαῖος
div1.sense: substituted by stealth, supposititious, of children, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ὑποβρέμω
div1.sense: to roar or rumble beneath, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποβρέχω
div1.sense: to wet or moisten a little:—Pass., perf. part. ὑποβεβρεγμένος somewhat drunk, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποβρύχιος
div1.sense: under water, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπόβρυχος
div1.sense: neut. pl. ὑπόβρυχα as adv., under water, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπογάστριον
div1.sense: the paunch, Lat. abdomen: the paunch of the tunny, a favourite dish at Athens, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπόγειος
div1.note: ὑπό-γειος, Ionic and λατε Attic -γαιος, ον,
div1.sense: under the earth, subterraneous, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ὑπογελάω
div1.sense: to laugh slily, Lat. subridere, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπογενειάζω
div1.sense: to entreat by touching the chin, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑπογίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to grow up after or in succession, Lat. subnasci, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπόγλαυκος
div1.sense: somewhat gray, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπογλαύσσω
div1.sense: to glance furtively, Mosch.

div1.head: ὑπογλυκαίνω
div1.sense: to sweeten a little: metaph. to coax and smooth down, τινά Ar.

div1.head: ὑπογνάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend gradually, Hhymn.

div1.head: ὑπογραμματεύς
div1.sense: an under-secretary, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ὑπογραμματεύω
div1.sense: to serve as under-secretary, τινί Oratt.

div1.head: ὑπογραφεύς
div1.sense: one who writes under anotherʼs orders, a secretary, amanuensis, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπογραφή
div1.sense: a signed bill of indictment, Plat.
an outline, τενόντων ὑπογραφαί traces of feet, Aesch.: — an outline, sketch, Lat. adumbratio, Plat., etc.
a painting under of the eyelids, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπογράφω
div1.sense: to write under an inscription, subjoin or add to it, Thuc.; ὑπογράψας ἐπιβουλεῦσαί με having added (to the accusation) that . . , Dem.:— Mid. to bring an additional accusation against him, Eur.
to sign, subscribe:—Mid., ὑπ. τὰς καταβολάς to sign and so make oneself liable, Dem.
to write from dictation, Plut.
to write under, i. e. to trace letters for children to write over, Plat.: metaph., νόμους ὑπ. to trace out laws as guides of action, Plat.
to trace in outline, sketch out, Lat. adumbrare, Plat., etc.
ὑπογράφειν or -γράφεσθαι τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς to paint under the eyelids, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπόγυιος
div1.sense: under oneʼs hand, nigh at hand, Isocr., Dem.
just out of hand, fresh, new, Lat. recens, Isocr., Dem.; ὑπόγυιόν ἐστι ἐξ οὗ . . , it is a very short time since . . , Isocr.
sudden, Arist.:— ἐξ ὑπογύου off hand, on the spur of the moment, Xen., Plat.
of persons, ὑπ. τῇ ὀργῇ in the first burst of anger, Arist.

div1.head: ὑποδαίω
div1.sense: to light, kindle under, Il.

div1.head: ὑποδακρύω
div1.sense: to weep a little or secretly, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποδαμνάω
div1.sense: to master or weaken beneath one, Il.:— Pass., ὑποδάμναμαι (as if from ὑποδάμνημι) to be overcome, let oneself be overpowered or overcome, Od.; aor1 part. ὑποδμηθεῖσα (v. δαμάζω, of a woman, subdued by a man, yielding to him, Hhymn., Hes.: —Mid., ἔρως φρένας ὑποδάμναται Theocr.

div1.head: ὑποδεδιώς
div1.sense: Comic name of a bird in Ar., fear-ling.

div1.head: ὑποδεής
div1.sense: somewhat deficient, inferior; mostly in comp. ὑποδεέστερος, Hdt., Plat.; ἐκ πολλῷ ὑποδεεστέρων with resources much inferior, Thuc.:—adv. -εστέρως, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπόδειγμα
div1.sense: a token, mark, Xen.:— a pattern, Polyb.

div1.head: ὑποδείδω
div1.sense: trans. to cower under or before, or to fear secretly, c. acc., Hom.:—so of birds, to cower beneath, αἰγυπιὸν ὑποδείσαντες Soph.
absol., Od.; cf. ὑποδεδιώς.

div1.head: ὑποδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to shew secretly, Hdt.; ὑποδέξας ὄλβον having given a glimpse of happiness, Hdt.; ὑπ. ἀρετήν to make a shew of virtue, Thuc.
absol. to indicate oneʼs will, Xen.
to shew by tracing out, mark out, Hdt.: absol. to set a pattern, Xen.
generally, to teach indirectly or by indication, Isocr.; c. inf., NTest.

div1.head: ὑποδεικτέος
div1.sense: to be traced out, Polyb.

div1.head: ὑποδειλιάω
div1.sense: to be somewhat cowardly, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑποδειμαίνω
div1.sense: to stand in secret awe of, τινά Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποδέμω
div1.sense: to lay as a foundation, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποδεξίη
div1.sense: the reception of a guest, means of entertainment, πᾶσά τοι ἔσθʼ ὑποδεξίη [ῑ, metri grat.], Il.

div1.head: ὑποδέξιος
div1.sense: capacious, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπόδεσις
div1.sense: a putting on oneʼs shoes, Arist., Luc.
as concrete, = τὰ ὑποδήματα, footgear, boots and shoes, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ὑποδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to receive beneath the surface, Il.
to receive into oneʼs house, receive hospitably, Hom., etc.; ὁ ὑποδεξάμενος oneʼs host, Isocr.
to give ear to, hearken to, εὐχάς Hes.; τοὺς λόγους Hdt.
to take in charge as a nurse, Hhymn., Plat.
metaph., πῆμα ὑπέδεκτό με sorrow was my host, Od.; στυγερὸς ὑπεδέξατο κοῖτος a hateful nest awaited them, of ensnared birds, Od.
to take upon oneself, undertake a task, promise, Hom.; with inf. fut., Hdt., etc.; less often with inf. aor., Hdt.; ὑπ. μεγάλα τινί to make him great promises, Hdt.
to admit, allow a charge, Hdt.; οὐκ ὑπ. to refuse to admit, deny, Hdt.
to submit to, bear patiently, Od.
like Lat. excipere,
to wait for, abide the attack of, Hes., Xen.:—of hunters, to lie in wait for game, Xen.
to come next to, border upon, Hdt.
of a woman, to conceive, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποδέω
div1.sense: to bind or fasten under, Hdt.

esp. to underbind, i. e. to shoe, because the sandals or shoes were bound on with straps, Plat.:—Mid. to bind under oneʼs feet, put on shoes, Ar., Xen., etc.; also c. acc., ὑποδησάμενος κοθόρνους Hdt.:—so in perf. pass., ὑποδήματα ὑποδεδεμένος with shoes on oneʼs feet, Plat.; and absol., ὑποδεδεμένοι with their shoes on, Xen.; so, ὑποδεδεμένοι τὸν ἀριστερὸν πόδα with shoes on the left foot, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποδηλόω
div1.sense: to shew privately, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπόδημα
div1.sense: a sole bound under the foot with straps, a sandal, ποσὶν ὑποδήματα δοῦσα (i. e. δέουσα) Od.; ποσὶν ὑποδήματα δοίην (i. e. δεοίην) Od., etc.; ὑπόδημα κοῖλον, or ὑπόδημα alone, = Lat. calceus, a shoe or half-boot, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ὑποδιδάσκαλος
div1.sense: an under-teacher, of a chorus, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give way, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπόδικος
div1.sense: brought to trial or liable to be tried, Lys., etc.: —tinos for a thing, Aesch., Oratt.; ὑπόδικός τινι liable to action from a person, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ὑποδίφθερος
div1.sense: clothed in skins, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποδμώς
div1.sense: an under-servant, Od.

div1.head: ὑπόδοσις
div1.sense: a remission, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποδοχή
div1.sense: a reception, entertainment, Hdt., Eur., etc.; εἰς ὑποδοχὴν τοῦ στρατεύματος for the reception of the army (in hostile sense), Thuc.
a harbouring of runaway slaves, Thuc.
means for entertaining, Plut.
acceptance, support, Aeschin.
a supposition, assumption, Dem.
a receptacle, reservoir, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπόδρα
div1.sense: adv. only in phrase ὑπόδρα ἰδών looking from under the brows, looking askance, grimly, Il.

div1.head: ὑποδρηστήρ
div1.sense: an under-servant, attendant, assistant, Od.

div1.head: ὑποδρομή
div1.sense: a running under or into the way of a thing, Antipho.

div1.head: ὑπόδρομος
div1.sense: running under, πέτρος ὑπ. ἴχνους a stone in the way of his foot, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπόδροσος
div1.sense: somewhat moistened or dewy, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑποδράω
div1.sense: to serve, be serviceable to, τινί Od.

div1.head: ὑποδύτης
div1.sense: a garment under a coat of mail, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποδύω
div1.sense: to put on under, κιθῶνας ὑποδύνειν τοῖσι εἵμασι Hdt.
to slip in under, Hdt.:—also to assume secretly, slip into, c. acc., Hdt.:—also to slip from under, Xen.
metaph. to undergo danger, Hdt.
Mid. ὑποδύομαι
to go under, get under, sink beneath, Lat. subire, c. acc., Od.; ὑπ. ὑπὸ τὴν ζεύγλην Hdt.:—so, ὑπ. ὑπὸ τῶν κεραμίδων to creep under, Ar.; φέρει τινὰ ὑποδεδυκότα underneath it, Ar..
to put oneʼs feet under a shoe, to put it on, Ar.
metaph. to put on a character (because the actorʼs face was put under a mask), Plat., Arist.
c. gen. to come from under, come forth from, Od.
to go under so as to bear, to bear on oneʼs shoulders, Il.
to enter into war, Hdt.
metaph. to undergo danger, c. acc., Xen.; ὑπ. αἰτίαν to make oneself subject to . . , Dem.
c. inf. to undertake to do, Hdt.
of feelings, to steal over one, c. acc., Aesch.:—c. dat., πᾶσιν ὑπέδυ γόος sorrow stole upon all, Od.
absol. to slip or slink away, Dem.
absol., ὀφθαλμοὶ ὑποδεδυκότες sunken eyes, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποζάκορος
div1.sense: an under-priest or priestess, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to yoke under, put under the yoke, ὑπ. ἵππους ἡμιόνους Od.:—Pass. to be yoked under, submit to, ἀνάγκαις Aesch.; πόνῳ Soph.

div1.head: ὑποζύγιον
div1.sense: a beast for the yoke, a beast of burden, Lat. jumentum, Theogn., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ὑπόζωμα
div1.sense: the diaphragm, midriff, Arist.
in pl. braces passed under the hull of a vessel, so as to undergird her (cf. ὑποζώννυμι II), Plat.

div1.head: ὑποζώννυμι
div1.sense: to undergird, Plut.:—Pass., ζειρὰς ὑπεζωσμένοι girt with ζειραί, Hdt.
to undergird or frap a ship (v. ὑπόζωμα II), Polyb., NTest.

div1.head: ὑπόζωσμα
div1.etym: less Attic form for ὑπόζωμα (II ), Plut.

div1.head: ὑποθάλπω
div1.sense: to heat inwardly, Aesch.:—Pass. to glow under a thing, c. dat., Anth.

div1.head: ὑποθερμαίνω
div1.sense: to heat a little:—Pass. to grow somewhat hot, be heated, Il.

div1.head: ὑπόθερμος
div1.sense: somewhat hot or passionate, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπόθεσις
div1.sense: that which is placed under, a foundation, hypothesis, supposition, Lat. assumptio, Plat.
the subject under discussion, the question, Xen., Dem., etc.
that which is laid down as a rule of action, a principle, Dem.: generally, a purpose, plan, design, Plat.
a cause, pretext, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποθετέος
div1.sense: one must assume, Arist.

div1.head: ὑποθέω
div1.sense: to run in under, make a secret attack, Pind.
to run in before, to supplant, Ar.
of dogs, to run in too hastily, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποθήκη
div1.sense: a suggestion, counsel, warning, piece of advice, Hdt., Arist.
a pledge, a mortgage, Dem.

div1.head: ὑποθημοσύνη
div1.sense: a suggestion, hint, warning, ὑποθημοσύνῃσιν Ἀθήνης (Epic dat. pl.) Hom.; Ἑρμοῦ ὑποθημοσύνῃ Xen.

div1.head: ὑποθλίβω
div1.sense: to press under or gently, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποθορυβέω
div1.sense: to begin to make a clamour, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποθρύπτομαι
div1.sense: Pass., to be delicate or remiss, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποθυμίς
div1.sense: an unknown bird, Ar.

div1.head: ὑποθωπεύω
div1.sense: to flatter a little, win by flattery, Ar.:—absol. to use flattery, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποθωρήσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to arm oneself in secret, Il.

div1.head: ὑποϊάχω
div1.sense: to sound forth in answer, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποικέω
div1.sense: to dwell under: to lie hidden, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build under a place, c. gen., Luc.

div1.head: ὑποικουρέω
div1.sense: to keep the house, stay at home: — metaph. to lurk, lie hidden, Luc.
trans. to engage in or plot underhand, Plut.
c. acc. pers. to work secretly upon, Plut.; νόσος ὑπ. αὐτούς crept in among them, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποιμώζω
div1.sense: to wail softly, to whimper, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποκάθημαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to be seated in a place, station oneself, Hdt.
to sit or lie in ambush, Xen.
c. acc. pers. to lie in wait for, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποκαθίζω
div1.sense: to place in ambush:—Mid. to lie in ambush, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποκαίω
div1.sense: to burn by applying fire below, Hdt.: to offer secret sacrifices, Aesch.
to light under, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποκάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend short back, turn in under, Il.
intr. to turn short back, double as a hare, Xen.:—metaph., c. acc., to fall short of, καιρόν Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποθυμίς
div1.sense: a garland worn on the neck, Sapph..

div1.head: ὑποκάρδιος
div1.sense: in the heart, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑποκαταβαίνω
div1.sense: to descend by degrees or stealthily, Hdt., Thuc.: to come down a little, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποκατακλίνω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to lie down under, to submit, yield, τινι to one, Plat.:—absol. to give in, Dem.

div1.head: ὑποκάτω
div1.sense: below, under, c. gen., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόκειμαι
div1.sense: to lie under or beneath, Il., Thuc.; c. dat., Plat.
in various metaph. senses,
to be put under the eyes or mind, i. e. to be submitted or proposed to one, Pind.; αἱ ὑποκείμεναι ἐλπίδες oneʼs present hopes, Dem.; ὑπόκειταί μοι ὅτι . . I have laid down the rule, that . . , Hdt.

to be laid down or assumed as an hypothesis, Plat., etc.; τούτων ὑποκειμένων Lat. his positis, Plat.; impers., ὑπόκειται a rule is laid down, Dem.; ὑποκείσθω ὅτι . . let it be granted that . . , Arist.
to be suggested, Hdt.
to be left at bottom, left remaining, Thuc., Dem.
to be subject to, submit to, τινι Plat.: absol. to be submissive, Plat.
to be left behind in pledge, to be pledged or mortgaged, τινος for a certain sum, Dem., etc.; ὑποκείμενοι, of persons, bound for payment of a sum of money, Dem.
to underlie, as a substratum, Plat., etc.
to be subordinate, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποκηρύσσω
div1.sense: Mid. to make known by voice of herald or crier, to have a thing proclaimed or cried, esp. for sale, Aeschin.; σεαυτὸν ὑπ. to advertise yourself, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποκινέω
div1.sense: to move lightly, Ζεφύρου ὑποκινήσαντος (sc. τὸ κῦμα) Il.
metaph. to urge gently on, Plat.
intr. to move a little, stir a finger, Hdt., Ar.
metaph. to be deranged, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποκλαίω
div1.sense: to shed secret tears, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποκλέπτω
div1.sense: to steal underhand, filch, Babr.: —Pass. to be stolen away, Pind.
ὑποκλέπτεσθαί τι to be defrauded of a thing, Soph.

div1.head: ὑποκλίνω
div1.sense: Mid.Pass. to recline or lie down under, c. dat., σχοίνῳ ὑπεκλίνθη Od.

div1.head: ὑποκλονέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be driven in confusion before one, τινι Il.

div1.head: ὑποκλοπέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lurk in secret places, Od.

div1.head: ὑποκλύζω
div1.sense: to wash from below, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποκνίζω
div1.sense: to tickle or excite a little, Pind.:— Pass. to be somewhat excited, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποκόλπιος
div1.sense: under the folds of the robe, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπόκοπος
div1.sense: somewhat tired, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποκόπτω
div1.sense: to cut beneath, to hamstring, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποκορίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to talk childʼs language,
trans. to call by endearing names, Ar.
to call by a fair name, gloss over or palliate, Plat., Dem.
reversely, to call something good by a bad name, to nickname, Xen.
intr. to use diminutives, Arist.

div1.head: ὑποκόρισμα
div1.sense: a coaxing or endearing name, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑποκορισμός
div1.sense: = ὑποκόρισμα, Plut.
the use of diminutives, Arist.

div1.head: ὑποκουρίζομαι
div1.sense: to soothe with soft names, Pind.

div1.head: ὑπόκουφος
div1.sense: somewhat light or fickle, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποκρατηρίδιον
div1.sense: the stand of a κρατήρ, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποκρέκω
div1.sense: of stringed instruments, to answer in sound, i. e. to sound in harmony with, τινί Pind.

div1.head: ὑποκρίνομαι
div1.etym: later also aor1 and perf. pass. in mid. sense
div1.sense: to reply, make answer, answer, Hom., Hdt.
to expound, interpret, explain, Od., Ar.:—the Attic word in this sense is ἀπο-κρίνομαι.

of actors, to answer on the stage: hence to play a part, τὴν Ἀντιγόνην ὑποκέκριται Dem.; ὑπ. τὸ βασιλικόν to take the kingʼs part, Arist.; ὑποκρ. τραγῳδίαν, κωμῳδίαν to play a tragedy, a comedy, Arist.; absol. to play a part, be an actor, Arist.
to represent dramatically: hence to exaggerate, Dem.
metaph. to play a part, to feign, pretend, c. inf., Dem.

div1.head: ὑποκρισία
div1.etym: rarer form for ὑπόκρισις II, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπόκρισις
div1.sense: in Ionic a reply, answer, Hdt.
in Attic the playing a part on the stage, the actorʼs art, Arist.
an oratorʼs delivery, declamation, Arist.
metaph. the playing a part, hypocrisy, Phocyl.

div1.head: ὑποκριτής
div1.sense: an interpreter or expounder, Plat., Luc.
one who plays a part on the stage, a player, actor, Ar., Plat., etc.
metaph. a pretender, dissembler, hypocrite, NTest.

div1.head: ὑποκριτικός
div1.sense: belonging to ὑπόκρισις (II), having a good delivery, Arist.
suited for speaking or delivery, ὑποκριτικωτάτη λέξις Arist.: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) , the art of delivery, Arist.
metaph. pretending to a thing, c. gen., Luc.

div1.head: ὑποκρούω
div1.sense: to strike gently, Anth.: to beat time, give the time, Plut.
metaph. to break in upon, interrupt, c. acc., Ar.
in Mid. to find fault with, attack, Ar.

div1.head: ὑποκρύπτω
div1.sense: to hide under or beneath, ἄχνῃ ὑπεκρύφθη [the ship] was hidden beneath the spray, Il.

div1.head: ὑποκρώζω
div1.sense: to croak faintly, as a sick person, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπόκυκλος
div1.sense: running on wheels, Od.

div1.head: ὑποκύω
div1.sense: Mid. to conceive, become pregnant, ὑποκῡσαμένη (not -κυσσαμένη) , Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ὑποκύπτω
div1.sense: to stoop under a yoke, οἱ Μῆδοι ὑπέκυψαν Πέρσῃσι bowed to the Persian yoke, Hdt.: absol., of suppliants, to bow down, Ar., Xen.
c. acc., ὑπ. τὰν τύλαν to stoop the shoulder so as to let a load be put on, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπόκυφος
div1.sense: somewhat humped, Strab.

div1.head: ὑποκώλιον
div1.sense: the thigh of an animal, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποκωμῳδέω
div1.sense: to ridicule a little, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπόκωφος
div1.sense: somewhat deaf, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ὑπολαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take up by getting under, as the dolphin did Arion, Hdt.: to receive into its bosom, NTest.
to bear up, support, Hdt.
to take by the hand, Plat.

to seize or come suddenly upon, of fear, Hom.; of a fit of madness, a pestilence, Hdt.; δυσχωρία ὑπελάμβανεν αὐτούς, i. e. they came suddenly into difficult ground, Xen.; then, of events, to follow next, come next, Hdt.
to take up the discourse and answer, to reply, rejoin, retort, Thuc., Plat., etc.:— absol., in dialogue, ἔφη ὑπολαβών, ὑπ. ἔφη, ὑπ. εἶπεν he said in answer, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
to take up, interrupt, Xen.
to take up the conqueror, fight with him, Lat. excipere, Thuc.
to take up a charge, Thuc.
= ὑποδέχομαι, to receive and protect, Xen.
to accept or entertain a proposal, Hdt., Dem.

to take up a notion, assume, suppose, c. inf., Hdt., Plat.:—the inf. omitted, to conceive of a thing as being so and so, Plat.; καίπερ ὑπειληφὼς ταῦτα though I assume this to be so, Dem.: —Pass., τοιοῦτος ὑπολαμβάνομαι Isocr.
to apprehend a thing, Eur., Plat.
to suspect, disbelieve, Xen.
to take secretly, Thuc.
to draw off from duty, seduce, Thuc.
ὑπ. ἵππον, as a term of horsemanship, to hold up or to check the horse, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπολαμπής
div1.sense: shining with inferior lustre, Hes.

div1.head: ὑπολάμπω
div1.sense: to shine under, shine in under, Xen.:—so in Mid., Anth.
to shine a little, begin to shine, just appear, τὸ ἔαρ ὑπέλαμπε Hdt.; ὑπ. ἡ ἡμέρα Plut.

div1.head: ὑπολείβω
div1.sense: to pour secret libations, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπολείπω
div1.sense: to leave remaining, Od., Thuc., etc.
of things, to fail one, ὑπολείψει ὑμᾶς ἡ μισθοφορά Lys.
Pass., c. fut. mid., to be left remaining, Hom., Hdt.
of things, to remain in force, Thuc.
to stay behind, Od.: c. gen., ὑπολείπεσθαι τοῦ στόλου to stay behind the expedition, i. e. not to go upon it, Hdt.
to be left behind in a race, Ar.: of stragglers in an army, to lag behind, Xen.; ὑπ. μικρὸν τοῦ στόματος to fall behind the front rank, Xen.
metaph. to be inferior to, τινός Arist.
absol. to fail, come to an end, Soph.:— ὑπ. τινά ὁ λόγος fails him, Arist.
Mid. to leave behind one, Hdt.; ὑπολείπεσθαι αἰτίαν to leave cause for reproach against oneself, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπόλεπτος
div1.sense: somewhat fine, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπολευκαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become white underneath or somewhat white, Il.

div1.head: ὑπολήνιον
div1.sense: the vessel under a press to receive the wine or oil, a vat, Lat. lacus, NTest.

div1.head: ὑποληπτέος
div1.sense: one must suppose, understand, think of, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόληψις
div1.sense: a taking up, esp. a taking up the word, taking up the matter where another leaves off, Plat.:— a rejoinder, reply, Isocr.
a taking in a certain sense, an assumption, conception, Dem.
a hasty judgment, suspicion, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπολίζων
div1.sense: somewhat less or fewer, Il.

div1.head: ὑπόλιθος
div1.sense: somewhat stony, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπολιμπάνω
div1.sense: to leave behind, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπολισθάνω
div1.sense: to slip or slide gradually, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπόλισπος
div1.sense: somewhat smooth, worn smooth, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπόλιχνος
div1.sense: somewhat lickerish or dainty, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπολογέω
div1.sense: to take account of, τινός Arist.

div1.head: ὑπολογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to take into account, take account of, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ὑπολογιστέος
div1.sense: one must take into account, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόλογος
div1.sense: held accountable or liable, Dem.; ὑπόλογον ποιεῖσθαι to hold responsible, Plat.; οὐδέν σοι ὑπόλογον τίθεμαι I put down nothing to your account, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόλογος2
div1.sense: a taking into account, a reckoning, account, ὑπόλογον ποιεῖσθαί τινος, Lat. rationem habere rei, Dem.; ἐν ὑπολόγῳ ποιεῖσθαί τι Lys.

div1.head: ὑπόλοιπος
div1.sense: left behind, staying behind, Hdt.; οἱ ὑπ. those who remained alive, Hdt.
of things, ὑπ. τὸ βάραθρον γίγνεται the pit still remains, Ar.; ὅσα ἦν ὑπ. all that remained to be done, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπολόχαγος
div1.sense: an under-λοχαγός, a lieutenant, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπολύριος
div1.sense: under the lyre; δόναξ ὑπ. a reed to which the lower ends of the strings were attached, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπολύω
div1.sense: to loosen beneath or below, ὑπέλυσε γυῖα made his limbs give way under him, Il.:—Pass., γυῖα ὑπέλυντο Il.
to loose from under the yoke, Hom., Thuc.:— to loose from bonds, Od.; in Mid., τὸν ὑπελύσαο δεσμῶν thou didst free him from bonds by stealth, Il.
to untie a personʼs sandals from under his feet, take off his shoes, Aesch., Ar.:—Mid. to take off oneʼs sandals or shoes, or to have them taken off, Ar.
c. acc. pers. to unshoe him, take off his shoes, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόμαζοι
div1.sense: the parts under the breast, Bion.

div1.head: ὑπόμακρος
div1.sense: somewhat long, longish, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπομαλακίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to grow cowardly by degrees, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπόμαργος
div1.sense: somewhat mad, in comp. ὑπομαργότερος, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπομάσσω
div1.sense: to smear or rub underneath, Theocr.

div1.head: ὕπομβρος
div1.sense: mixed with rain, θέρος ὑπ. a rainy summer, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπομειδιάω
div1.sense: to smile a little or gently, Anacreont.

div1.head: ὑπομείων
div1.sense: somewhat less:— ὑπομείονες, subordinate citizens, opp. to ὅμοιοι, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπομέμφομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to blame a little or secretly, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπομεμψίμοιρος
div1.sense: somewhat discontented with his lot, Cic.

div1.head: ὑπομενετέος
div1.sense: one must sustain, abide, endure, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ὑπομενετικός
div1.sense: patient of, τῶν δεινῶν Arist.

div1.head: ὑπομένω
div1.sense: to stay behind, survive, Od., Hdt., Attic
trans.,
c. acc. pers. to await another, to await his attack, bide the onset, Il., Hdt.; ὑπ. τὰς Σειρῆνας to abide their presence, Xen.
c. acc. rei, to be patient under, abide patiently, submit to, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; ὑπ. τὴν κρίσιν to await oneʼs trial, Aeschin.: to wait for, τὴν ἑορτήν Thuc.
absol. to stand oneʼs ground, stand firm, Il., Hdt., etc.; ὑπομένων καρτερεῖν to endure patiently, Plat.
c. inf. to submit or dare to do a thing, wait to do, persist in doing, like Lat. sustinere, Od., Xen.

so with part. relating to the subject, εἰ ὑπομενέουσι χεῖρας ἀνταειρόμενοι if they shall dare to lift their hands, Hdt.; ὑπομένει ὠφελούμενος he submits to be helped, Plat.:—with part. relating to the object, ὑπ. Ξέρξεα ἐπιόντα to await his attack, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ὑπομείγνυμι
div1.sense: to add by mixing, Lat. admisceo, τί τινι Plat.
intr. to run close under a place, c. dat., Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπομιμνήσκω
div1.sense: Act.,
to remind one of a person or thing, τινά τινος Od., Thuc.; ὑπ. τινά τι Thuc., Xen.: ὑπ. τινά to put him in mind, Plat.
c. acc. rei, to bring back to oneʼs mind, mention, suggest, τι Hdt., Soph., etc.; τινί τι Aesch.
c. gen. rei, to remind one of, to make mention of, Thuc., etc.
Pass. or Mid. to call to mind, remember, Xen.
to make mention, περί τινος Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπόμισθος
div1.sense: serving for pay, hired, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπομνάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to court clandestinely, ὑπεμνάασθε (Epic 2nd pl. imperf.) γυναῖκα Od.

div1.head: ὑπόμνημα
div1.sense: a remembrance, memorial, Thuc., etc.
a note, memorandum, Dem.:—in pl. memoranda, notes, minutes, Lat. commentarii, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόμνησις
div1.sense: a reminding, Thuc., etc.
a mentioning, ὑπ. ποιεῖσθαί τινος to make mention of a thing, Thuc.; ὑπ. κακῶν a tale of woe, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπομνηστεύομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to betroth, Arist.:—Pass., ὑπομνηστευθείς one betrothed, Arist.

div1.head: ὑπόμνυμι
div1.sense: Mid.
to make oath that a person cannot appear in court: to apply for a postponement of the trial, Dem.:—Pass., ὑπομοσθέντος τούτου this affidavit being put in by way of excuse, Dem.
to bar proceedings by an affidavit in a γραφὴ παρανόμων, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπομονή
div1.sense: a remaining behind, Arist.
a holding out, patient endurance, Arist.:— the enduring to do, αἰσχρῶν ἔργων Theophr.

div1.head: ὑπόμωρος
div1.sense: rather stupid or silly, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποναίω
div1.sense: to dwell under a place, c. acc., Anth.

div1.head: ὑπονέμομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to eat away beneath or secretly, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπονέφελος
div1.sense: under the clouds, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπονήϊος
div1.sense: under the promontory Neium, lying at its base, Od.

div1.head: ὑπονήχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to swim under water, dive, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπονείφω
div1.sense: to snow a little: impers., ὑπένειφε it was snowing a little, Thuc.:—Pass., νὺξ ὑπονειφομένη a snowy night, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπονοέω
div1.sense: to think secretly, suspect, Hdt., Eur., etc.:—c. acc. pers. et inf. to suspect that . . , Hdt.; τῶν λεγόντων ὑπενοεῖτε you feel suspicious of the speakers, Thuc.
generally, to suspect, conjecture, form guesses about, Ar.: absol., ὑπονοοῦντες by conjecture, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόνοια
div1.sense: a hidden thought: hence,
a suspicion, conjecture, guess, supposition, Ar., etc.; ὑπόνοιαι τῶν μελλόντων notions formed of future events, Thuc.
the real meaning of a thing, the true intent, deeper sense, Xen., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ὑπονομηδόν
div1.sense: by means of pipes, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπόνομος
div1.sense: underground, Strab.
ὑπόνομος, ὁ, as Subst. an underground passage, mine, Thuc.
a water-pipe, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπονοσέω
div1.sense: to be rather sickly, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπονοστέω
div1.sense: to go back, retire, Hdt.:— to go down, sink, settle, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπονόστησις
div1.sense: subsidence, of the sea, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπονύσσω
div1.sense: to prick or sting underneath: generally, to sting, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑπονυστάζω
div1.sense: to fall asleep gradually, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόξυλος
div1.sense: wooden underneath, i. e. of wood covered with a coat of metal, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποξυράω
div1.sense: to shave or cut off some of the hair: —Pass., perf. part. ὑπεξυρημένος shorn or shaven, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποξύριος
div1.sense: under the rasor, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποξύω
div1.sense: to scrape slightly, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποπαλαίω
div1.sense: to go down voluntarily in wrestling, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποπάσσω
div1.sense: to strew under, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποπεινάω
div1.sense: to be hungry, to begin to be hungry, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπόπεμπτος
div1.sense: sent covertly, as a spy, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποπέμπω
div1.sense: to send under: Pass. to be sent beneath, σκότον Eur.
to send secretly: to send as a spy, send in a false character, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ὑποπέρδομαι
div1.sense: to break wind a little, Ar.

div1.head: ὑποπερκάζω
div1.sense: to begin to turn colour, of grapes, Od.

div1.head: ὑποπετάννυμι
div1.sense: to spread out under, Od.

div1.head: ὑπόπετρος
div1.sense: somewhat rocky, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποπιθηκίζω
div1.sense: to play the ape a little, Ar.

div1.head: ὑποπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill by degrees:—Pass., πώγωνος ἤδη ὑποπιμπλάμενος now beginning to have a thick beard, Plat.; ὑποπίμπλαμαι τοὺς ὀφθαλμοὺς δακρύων have my eyes filling with tears, Luc.
in Pass. of women, τέκνων ὑποπλησθῆναι to become mothers of many children, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποπίμπρημι
div1.sense: to set on fire below, τὴν ὕλην Hdt.
to burn as on a funeral-pyre, τινάς Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποπίνω
div1.sense: to drink a little, drink moderately, Plat.
to drink slowly, go on drinking, Ar., Xen.
ὑπο-πεπωκώς rather tipsy, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ὑποπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall under or down, to sink in, Plut.
to fall down before any one, c. acc., Plat.: —hence, to be subject to him, fall under his power, Isocr.; of a flatterer, to cringe to, τινί Dem.; c. acc. ὑποπεσὼν τὸν δεσπότην Ar.
to fall behind another, Dem.
to get in under or among, Thuc.
of accidents, to happen, fall out, Isocr.
of persons, to fall under a punishment, c. dat., Plut.
of places, to lie under or below, c. dat., Polyb.

div1.head: Ὑποπλάκιος
div1.sense: under mount Placus, in the Troad, Il.

div1.head: ὑπόπλεος
div1.sense: pretty full, c.gen., δείματός εἰμι ὑπ. am somewhat afraid, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποπλέω
div1.sense: to sail under, ὑπ. τὴν Κύπρον, i. e. under the lee of Cyprus, NTest.

div1.head: ὑποπνέω
div1.sense: to blow gently, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπό

trans.i: from under, by, c. gen. under, c. dat., towards c. acc.

div1.sense: Lat. sub, prep. with gen., dat. and acc.
WITH GEN.,

of Place, from under, ῥέει κρήνη ὑπὸ σπείους Od.: of rescuing from under anotherʼs power, after the Verbs ἐρύεσθαι, ἁρπάζειν, Il.; ἵππους λῦσαν ὑπὸ ζυγοῦ they loosed the horses from under the yoke, Hom.
under, beneath, μοχλὸν ὑπὸ σποδοῦ ἤλασα thrust the bar in under the embers, Od.; ὑπὸ στέρνοιο τυχήσας having hit him under the breast, Il.; ὑπὸ χθονός Hom., etc.

of the Agent, with pass. Verbs, by, Lat. a or ab, ὑπό τινος δαμῆναι Il.; ὑφʼ ἑαυτοῦ by oneʼs own action, i.e. of oneself, Thuc.; so also, with neut. verbs, φεύγειν ὑπό τινος, i. e. to flee before him, Il.; ἔπαινον ἔχειν ὑπό τινος Hdt.
of things as well as persons, ὡς διάκειμαι ὑπὸ τῆς νόσου Thuc.; ἐνδακρύειν χαρᾶς ὕπο Aesch.; μαίνεται ὑφʼ ἡδονῆς Soph.; ὀρύσσειν ὑπὸ μαστίγων to dig under fear of scourges, Hdt.

of accompanying music, to the sound of, κωμάζειν ὑπʼ αὐλοῦ Hes.; πίνειν ὑπὸ σάλπιγγος Ar.: then, of anything attendant, δαΐδων ὑπὸ λαμπομενάων ἠγίνεον by torchlight, Il.; ὑπʼ εὐφήμου βοῆς θῦσαι to offer a sacrifice accompanied by it, Soph.; ὑπὸ πομπῆς in or with solemn procession, Hdt.
WITH DAT. of Place or Position, ὑπὸ ποσσί Il.; ὑπὸ πλατανίστῳ Il.; ὑπʼ Ἰλίῳ under its walls, Eur.; ὑφʼ ἅρμασι under, i. e. yoked to, the chariot, Il.
ὑπὸ χερσί τινος δαμῆναι to be subdued under, i. e. by force of his arms, Il.; ὑπὸ δουρὶ δαμῆναι Il.
of the person under whose power or influence a thing is done, φέβεσθαι ὑπό τινι to flee before him, Il.; ὑπὸ πομπῇ τινος βῆναι to go under his convoy, Il.
expressing subjection, ὑπό τινι under oneʼs power, Od.; εἶναι ὑπό τινι to be subject to him, Thuc.; ἔχειν ὑφʼ ἑαυτῷ to have under one, Xen.
of things coming under a class, ἐργασίαι ὑπὸ ταῖς τέχναις Plat.
as in A. II. 3, ὑπʼ αὐλητῆρι πρόσθʼ ἔκιον advanced to the music of the flute-player, Hes.: generally, of attendant circumstances, ἐξ ἁλὸς εἶσι πνοιῇ ὕπο Ζεφύροιο Od.; ὑπὸ σκότῳ, νυκτί Aesch.
WITH ACCUS. of Place, towards and under, ὑπὸ σπέος ἤλασε μῆλα drove them under, i.e. into, the cave, Il.; ὑπὸ ζυγὸν ἤγαγεν Od.; ὑπὸ δικαστήριον ἄγειν to bring under or before the tribunal, Hdt.
like ὑπό c. dat. without sense of motion, ὑπʼ ἠῶ τʼ ἠέλιόν τε everywhere under the sun, Il.; ὑπὸ τὴν ἄρκτον Hdt.; τὸ ὑπὸ τὴν ἀκρόπολιν Thuc.
of subjection, ποιεῖσθαι ὑπὸ σφᾶς Thuc., etc.

of Time, like Lat. sub, just after, just about, ὑπὸ νύκτα towards night, Il.; ὑπὸ ταῦτα about that time, Hdt.; ὑπὸ τὸν νηὸν κατακαέντα about the time of its burning, Il.; ὑπὸ τὸν σεισμόν about the time of the earthquake, Thuc.
of accompaniment, ὑπὸ αὐλὸν διαλέγεσθαι Xen.
ὑπό τι, as adv. to a certain degree, in some measure, Lat. aliquatenus, Plat.
POSITION: ὑπό can always follow its Subst., becoming by anastrophe ὕπο.
AS ADV., under, below, beneath, Hom.
behind, Hdt.
secretly, unnoticed, Il.
IN COMPOSITION:
under, both of rest and motion, as ὕπ-ειμι, ὑπο-βαίνω.
of the casing or covering of one thing with another, as ὑπό-χρυσος.
to express subjection, ὑπο-δαμνάω, ὑφ-ηνίοχος.
somewhat, a little, ὑπο-κινέω, ὑπό-λευκος: underhand, secretly, ὑπο-θωπεύω.

div1.head: ὑποπόδιον
div1.sense: a footstool, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποποιέω
div1.sense: to put under:—Mid. to subject to oneself, Luc.
to produce gradually, Plut.
in Mid. to gain by underhand tricks, to win over, τινά Dem.
in Mid. to assume, affect, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποπόλιος
div1.sense: somewhat gray, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go beneath the ground, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπόπορτις
div1.sense: with a calf under her, of a cow:— metaph. of a woman, Hes.

div1.head: ὑποπρίασθαι
div1.sense: Dep. to buy under the price, Theophr.

div1.head: ὑποπρίω
div1.sense: to gnash the teeth secretly, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπόπτερος
div1.sense: winged, Hdt., Soph., etc.; of a ship, Pind.
metaph. swift-flying, soaring, Pind.; ὑπ. φροντίς flighty, giddy thought, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποπτεύω
div1.sense: to be suspicious, Xen.; also, ὑπ. εἴς τινα to have suspicions of him, Thuc.
to suspect, guess, suppose, Xen.
trans. to suspect, hold in suspicion, Soph., Thuc.; ὑπ. τινὰ εἴς τι of something, Hdt., etc.:—Pass. to be suspected, mistrusted, Thuc.; impers., ὡς ὑπωπτεύετο as was generally suspected, Xen.
c. acc. pers. et inf. to suspect that, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
c. acc. rei, to look suspiciously on, Thuc.:—but also, ὑπ. τι to suspect something, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ὑπόπτης
div1.sense: suspicious, jealous, Soph., Thuc.: of a horse, shy, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποπτήσσω
div1.sense: to crouch or cower beneath, like hares or birds, πετάλοις ὑποπεπτηῶτες (Epic part. perf. for ὑποπεπτηκότες) , Il.; ὑποπτήξας τάφῳ Eur.
metaph. to crouch before another, bow down to, τινί Xen.; also, ὑπ. τινά Aesch., Xen.:—absol. to be modest or shy, Xen.

div1.head: ὕποπτος
div1.sense: looked at from beneath the brows, i. e. viewed with suspicion or jealousy, Lat. suspectus, Aesch., Thuc.; c. inf., ὑπ. αὐτοῖς μὴ πέμψαι suspected by them of not having sent, Thuc.
of things, τάδʼ ἦν ὕποπτα Eur.; ὕποπτον καθεστήκει it was a matter of jealousy, Thuc.
adv., ὑπόπτως διακεῖσθαι or ἔχειν to lie under suspicion, Thuc., Xen.
act. suspecting, suspicious of a thing, c. gen., Eur.:— τὸ ὕποπτον suspicion, jealousy, Thuc.; τῷ ὑπ. μου from suspicion of me, Thuc.:—adv. with suspicion, Thuc.; ὑπ. ἔχειν πρός τινα Dem.

div1.head: ὑποπτυχίς
div1.sense: a joint, τοῦ θώρακος Plut.

div1.head: ὑποπυθμίδιος
div1.sense: under the bottom, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπόπωλος
div1.sense: with a foal under her, Strab.

div1.head: ὑπόρνυμι
div1.sense: to rouse secretly or gradually, Hom.; τοῖον γὰρ ὑπώρορε Μοῦσα such was the Museʼs power to move, Od.:—Pass. to rise secretly or gradually, Od.

div1.head: ὑπόροφος
div1.sense: ὑπ. βοά the soft note of the pipe, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπορράπτω
div1.sense: to stitch underneath: metaph., ὑπ. λόγον to make up a story, Eur.

div1.head: ὑπορρέω
div1.sense: to flow under or beneath, Plut.
to flow gradually away, Plut.: metaph. to stream gradually to a place, Luc.
metaph. also, to slip or glide into unperceived, Lat. subrepere, Plat., Dem.
to slip away, of time, Ar.; of flowers, to perish, Theocr.; of the hair, to fall off, Luc.; and of friends, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπορρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to make to burst downwards: — Pass., οὐρανόθεν ὑπερράγη (aor2) αἰθήρ ether was cleft from beneath the sky, Il.

div1.head: ὑπόρρηνος
div1.sense: with a lamb under it, Il.

div1.head: ὑπορριπίζω
div1.sense: to fan from below or gently, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπορρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw under, ὑπ. τινὰ τοῖς θηρίοις to throw him to the wild beasts, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπορύσσω
div1.sense: to dig under, undermine, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dance with or to music, Aesch.:—c. acc. cogn., ὄρχησιν ὑπ. Plut.
to sing and dance a character, of a pantomimic actor, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπόρχημα
div1.sense: a hyporcheme or choral hymn to Apollo, mostly in Cretic verses, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόσαθρος
div1.sense: somewhat rotten, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποσαλπίζω
div1.sense: to prelude on the trumpet, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποσείραιος
div1.sense: dragged alongside, Eur.

div1.head: ὑποσείω
div1.sense: to shake below: ὑποσσείουσιν ἱμάντι they set it in motion below by the thong by which an auger is turned, Od.

div1.head: ὑποσημαίνω
div1.sense: to give secret signs of, to indicate or intimate, Thuc.
in military sense, σάλπιγγι ὑπ. to make signal by sound of trumpet, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποσιγάω
div1.sense: to be silent during, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑποσίδηρος
div1.sense: having a mixture or proportion of iron in it, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποσιωπάω
div1.sense: to pass over in silence, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὑποσκάζω
div1.sense: to halt a little, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποσκαλεύω
div1.sense: to stir underneath, poke up, τὸ πῦρ Ar.

div1.head: ὑποσκάπτω
div1.sense: to dig under, ὑπ. μακρὰ ἅλματα to mark a long leap by a line, Pind.

div1.head: ὑποσκελίζω
div1.sense: to trip up oneʼs heels, upset, Lat. supplantare, Dem., Luc.
metaph., ὑπ. καὶ ἀνατρέπων Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ὑπόσκιος
div1.sense: under shade, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποσόλοικος
div1.sense: guilty of a slight solecism, Cic.

div1.head: ὑποσπανίζομαι
div1.sense: to be scant or stinted of a thing, c. gen., Aesch.
of things, to be lacking, left undone, Soph.

div1.head: ὑποσπάω
div1.sense: to draw away from under, Plat., Dem.
to withdraw secretly, ὑπέσπασε φυγῇ πόδα withdrew his foot secretly, stole away, Eur.

div1.head: ὑποσπείρω
div1.sense: to sow secretly, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπόσπονδος
div1.sense: under a treaty, bound or secured by treaty, Hdt., Xen.:—esp. of taking up the dead from a field of battle, τοὺς νεκροὺς ὑποσπόνδους ἀποδιδόναι to allow a truce for taking up the dead, Thuc.; τοὺς νεκροὺς ὑπ. κομίζεσθαι, ἀναιρεῖσθαι to demand a truce for so doing, in acknowledgment of defeat, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ὑποστάθμη
div1.sense: sediment, Plat.; ἐν τῇ Ῥωμύλου ὑποστάθμῃ, in faece Romuli, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπόστασις
div1.sense: that which settles at the bottom, sediment, Arist.
anything set under, subject-matter of a speech or poem, Polyb., etc.
the foundation or ground of hope, confidence, assurance, NTest.
substance, the real nature of a thing, essence, NTest.

div1.head: ὑποστάτης
div1.sense: that which stands under, a support, prop, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποστατός
div1.sense: to be borne or endured, Eur.

div1.head: ὑποσταχύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to grow up or wax gradually like ears of corn, Od.

div1.head: ὑποστεγάζω
div1.sense: to support from underneath, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπόστεγος
div1.sense: under the roof, in or into the house, Soph.

div1.head: ὑποστέγω
div1.sense: to hide under, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποστέλλω
div1.sense: to draw in, ἱστίον ὑπέστειλε made him furl his sail, Pind.
to draw back for shelter, Plut.; ὑπ. ἑαυτόν to shelter oneself behind, τινί Plut.; also to withdraw himself, NTest.
Mid., ὑποστέλλεσθαί τι to cloak a thing through fear, to prevaricate, dissemble, Eur., Plat., etc.; μηδὲν ὑποστειλάμενος without dissimulation, Dem.

div1.head: ὑποστενάζω
div1.sense: to moan in an undertone, Soph.
to groan under the weight of, τι Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποστεναχίζω
div1.sense: to groan beneath one, c. dat., Il., Hes.

div1.head: ὑποστένω
div1.sense: to moan in a low tone, begin to moan, Soph.: to grumble, Ar.

div1.head: ὑποστηρίζω
div1.sense: to underprop, sustain, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποστολή
div1.sense: a shrinking back, evasion, NTest.

div1.head: ὑποστόρνυμι
div1.sense: to spread, lay or strew under, esp. of bed-clothes, δέμνια ὑποστορέσαι Od.; λέκτρα ὑποστρῶσαί τινι to make his bed for a man, i. e. serve him as a wife, Eur.:—Pass., αἱ εὐναὶ ὑποστόρνυνται Xen.; ᾗ χαλκὸς ὑπέστρωται which has copper laid under it, ap. Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποστρατηγέω
div1.sense: to serve as lieutenant under another, c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: ὑποστράτηγος
div1.sense: a lieutenant-general, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn round about, turn back, ἵππους Il.; Βακχίαν ὑποστρέφων ἅμιλλαν bringing back the Bacchic struggle, i. e. changing sorrow into tumultuous joy, Soph.
intr. to turn about, turn short round, Il., Hdt., Attic:—so in Pass., αὖτις ὑποστρεφθείς Il., etc.
generally, to return, Od., Hdt.; so in fut. mid., Od.
to turn away, and so elude an attack, Eur., Xen.
part. ὑποστρέψας as adv. reversely, Ar.

div1.head: ὑποστροβέω
div1.sense: to agitate inwardly, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποστροφή
div1.sense: a turning about, wheeling round, Hdt.: ἐξ ὑποστροφῆς, of the chariot, after turning round the meta at the end of the δίαυλος, i. e. turning sharply round, Soph.:— on the contrary, ap. Dem.

div1.head: ὑπόστρωμα
div1.sense: that which is spread under, a bed, litter, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποστύφω
div1.sense: to be somewhat astringent, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποσυγχέω
div1.sense: to confuse a little:—Pass. to be somewhat confused, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποσυρίζω
div1.sense: to whistle gently, rustle, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποσύρω
div1.sense: to drag down, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ὑποσφίγγω
div1.sense: to bind tight below, Anth.

div1.head: ὑπόσχεσις
div1.sense: an undertaking, engagement, promise, Hom., Hdt., Attic; ὑπ. ἀπολαβεῖν to receive the fulfilment of a promise, Xen.; ἀπαιτεῖν τὰς ὑπ. to demand their fulfilment, Arist.; ὑπ. ψεύδεσθαι to fail in its performance, Aeschin.
a profession (as a mode of life), Luc.

div1.head: ὑποταγή
div1.sense: subordination, subjection, submission, NTest.

div1.head: ὑποταράσσω
div1.sense: to stir up, trouble from below or a little, Ar.:—Pass. to be somewhat troubled, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποταρβέω
div1.sense: to shrink before, τινά Il.

div1.head: ὑποταρτάριος
div1.sense: under Tartarus, of the Titans, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ὑπότασις
div1.sense: extension, πεδίων ὑποτάσεις the plains that stretch below, Eur.

div1.head: ὑποτάσσω
div1.sense: to place or arrange under, τί τινι Plut.
to post under, to subject, ἑαυτόν τινι Plut.; ἑαυτῷ τὰ πάντα NTest.:—Pass. to be obedient, τινι NTest.

div1.head: ὑποτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch under, put under, ἀντηρίδας ὑπ. πρὸς τοὺς τοίχους to fix stay-beams so as to strengthen the shipʼs sides, Thuc.
to strain tight, Ar.: metaph. to intensify, Soph.
to hold out hopes, to offer to do a thing, c. inf., Hdt., Thuc.:—also, ὑπ. τινὶ μισθούς Ar.; ἐλπίδας Dem.
to suggest, ὑπ. τινὶ λέγειν Eur.

div1.head: ὑποτειχίζω
div1.sense: to build a wall under or across, build a cross-wall, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποτείχισις
div1.sense: the building of a cross-wall, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποτείχισμα
div1.sense: a cross-wall, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποτελέω
div1.sense: to pay off, discharge a payment, Hdt., Xen., etc.; absol. to pay tribute, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποτελής
div1.sense: subject to pay taxes, taxable, tributary, Lat. vectigalis, Thuc.; in full, ὑποτελὴς φόρου Thuc.
act. receiving as payment, c. gen., Luc.

div1.head: ὑποτέμνω
div1.sense: to cut away under, cut away, Hom.: Pass., Aeschin.
to cut underhand or unfairly, of a leather-seller, Ar.
to cut off, intercept, Xen.: so in Hdt.; ὑποτέμνεσθαι τὰς ὁδούς to cut off oneʼs way, stop one short, Ar.; ὑποτέμνεσθαί τινα to intercept him, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποτίθημι
div1.sense: to place under, τί τινι Il.:—Mid. to place under oneʼs feet, Xen.

to place under as a foundation or beginning, Xen., Dem.:—Pass. to be laid down, assumed, Plat.:—Mid. to lay down as a principle, take for granted, assume, Plat., Dem.; c. acc. et inf. to assume or suppose that . . , Plat.

to hold out under, present, Luc.: metaph. to suggest, Eur., etc.:—so in Mid. to suggest, hint a thing to one, ὑποθέσθαι τινὶ βουλήν Il.; ἔπος, ἔργον ὑποθέσθαι τινί to suggest a speech, an action, to any one, advise or counsel him thereto, Hom., Hdt., etc.
c. dat. pers. only, ὑποθέσθαι τινί to advise, admonish one, Od., Ar., etc.: c. inf. to advise one to do a thing, Hdt., Thuc.
to propose, σκοπόν as a mark or aim, Arist.:—Mid. to propose to oneself, Isocr.
to put down as a deposit or stake, to pawn, pledge, mortgage, Hdt., Aeschin., etc.:—in Mid., of the mortgagee, to lend money on pledge, Dem.
to stake, hazard, venture, Plat.; ὑποθεὶς τὸν ἴδιον κίνδυνον at his own risk, Dem.

div1.head: ὑποτιμάω
div1.sense: Mid. as law-term, much like ἀντιτιμάομαι to propose a less penalty for oneself, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποτοβέω
div1.sense: to sound in answer, echo, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑποτονθορύζω
div1.sense: to murmur in an under-tone, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποτοπεύω
div1.sense: τινά Thuc.; c. acc. et inf., Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποτοπέω
div1.sense: to suspect, surmise, Thuc.; c. acc. et inf., Thuc.
c. acc. pers. to suspect him, Thuc.
so as Dep. ὑποτοπέομαι to suspect a thing, Hdt., Ar.; c. acc. et inf. to suspect that . . , Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ὑποτραυλίζω
div1.sense: to lisp a little, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποτρέμω
div1.sense: to tremble a little, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποτρέφω
div1.sense: to bring up secretly:—Mid. to cherish secretly, Xen., Luc.:—Pass. to grow up in succession, Lat. subnasci, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποτρέχω
div1.sense: to run in under, ὑπέδραμε καὶ λάβε γούνων she ran in under the sword and clasped his knees, Od.; ὑπὸ τοὺς πόδας τοῦ ἵππου ὑπέδραμε κύων Hdt.: hence to trip up, Ar.
to run or stretch away under, Hhymn.
to run in between, intercept, Ar., Xen.
to insinuate oneself into any oneʼs good graces, flatter or deceive, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ὑποτρέω
div1.sense: to tremble a little, to shrink back, give ground, Il.: c. acc. to flee before, Il.

div1.head: ὑποτρίβω
div1.sense: to rub down the ingredients of a dish, Cratin.

div1.head: ὑπότριμμα
div1.sense: a dish compounded of various ingredients, pounded up together, Lat. moretum, Com.

div1.head: ὑποτρομέω
div1.sense: to tremble under one, of a manʼs limbs, Il.

div1.head: ὑπότρομος
div1.sense: somewhat afraid or timid, Aeschin., Luc.

div1.head: ὑποτροπή
div1.sense: a turning back, repulse, Plut.
a relapse, recurrence, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπότροπος
div1.sense: returning, Hom., Eur.
rallying from the effect of a blow, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑποτρύζω
div1.sense: to murmur, hum in an undertone, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποτρώγω
div1.sense: to eat by way of preparation, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποτυπόω
div1.sense: to sketch out, Lat. adumbrare, Arist.

div1.head: ὑποτύπτω
div1.sense: to strike or push down, κοντῷ ὑπ. ἐς λίμνην to poke down into the lake with a pole, Hdt.; ὑποτύπτουσα φιάλῃ ἐς τὴν θήκην dipping with a cup into the chest, Hdt.; ὑποτύψας τούτῳ (sc. τῷ κηλωνηίῳ) ἀντλέει he draws it dipping with the bucket into the water, Hdt.; ὑπ. τοῖν ποδοῖν Ar.

div1.head: ὑποτύπωσις
div1.sense: an outline, pattern, NTest.

div1.head: ὑποτύφω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to burn with a smouldering fire, burn secretly, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ὑπότυφος
div1.sense: somewhat arrogant, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπουθάτιος
div1.sense: under the udder, sucking, Anth.

div1.head: ὕπουλος
div1.sense: of wounds, festering under the scar: metaph. with festering sores underneath, unsound beneath, Plat., etc.; ὕπ. αὐτονομία a hollow independence, Thuc.; κάλλος κακῶν ὕπουλον a fair outside skinning over ills below, Soph.:—adv., ὑπούλως ἀκροᾶσθαι to render a hollow obedience, Plut.

div1.head: ὑπουράνιος
div1.sense: under heaven, under the sky, Il.
reaching up to heaven, Hom.

div1.head: ὑπουργέω
div1.sense: to render service or help to one, to serve, assist, succour, τινί Hdt., etc.; χρηστὰ ὑπ. (sc. τοῖς Ἀθηναίοισι) to do them good service, Hdt., etc.; ὑπ. χάριν τινί Aesch.:—Pass., τὰ ὑπουργημένα services done or rendered, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπούργημα
div1.sense: a service done or rendered, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ὑπουργητέος
div1.sense: one must be kind to, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπουργία
div1.sense: service rendered, Soph., Arist.

div1.head: ὑπουργός
div1.sense: rendering service, serviceable, promoting, conducive to a thing, c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: ὑποφαίνω
div1.sense: to bring to light from under, θρῆνυν ὑπέφηνε τραπέζης he drew the stool from under the table, Od.
to shew a little, just shew, Dem.
Pass. to be seen under, ὑπὸ τὰς πύλας πόδες ὑποφαίνονται Thuc.
to just shew oneself, be half seen, Xen.
Act. used intr. of the dawn of day, ὑποφαίνει ἡμέρα day just begins to break, Xen.; so, ὑποφαίνει ἔαρ Xen.:—metaph., τὰ νῦν ὑποφαίνοντα the difficulties now dawning upon us, Plat.

div1.head: ὑπόφαυσις
div1.sense: a light shewing through a small hole: a narrow opening, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποφείδομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to spare a little, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποφειδομένως
div1.sense: somewhat sparingly, rarely, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποφέρω
div1.sense: to carry away under, esp. to bear out of danger, Il.
to bear or carry by being under, to bear a burden, Xen.: metaph. to support, bear, endure, submit to, πόνους καὶ κινδύνους Isocr.; γῆρας καὶ πενίαν Aeschin., etc.
to hold out, suggest, proffer, Soph.; to pretend, allege, Xen.
to carry down:—Pass. to be borne down by a stream, Plut.: metaph. to slip or sink down, decay, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee from under, shun, Il., Eur.: to withdraw from, endeavour to evade, Thuc.
absol. to retire a little, withdraw, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποφητεύω
div1.sense: to hold the office of ὑποφήτης, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποφήτης
div1.sense: a suggester, interpreter, a priest who declares an oracle, Il.; Μουσάων ὑποφῆται, i. e. poets, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑποφθάνω
div1.sense: to haste before, be or get beforehand, Il.; ὑποφθάμενος κτεῖνεν Od.
c. acc. to be beforehand with one, Plut.; Mid., τὸν ὑποφθαμένη φάτο μῦθον Od.

div1.head: ὑποφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to speak in an undertone, of a ventriloquist, Plat.
to reply, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποφθονέω
div1.sense: to feel secret envy at, τινί Xen.

div1.head: ὑπόφθονος
div1.sense: somewhat jealous: adv., ὑποφθόνως ἔχειν to behave somewhat jealously, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποφλέγω
div1.sense: to heat from below, Anth.

div1.head: ὑποφόνιος
div1.sense: murdering secretly, Soph.

div1.head: ὑποφορά
div1.sense: a holding under, putting forward, by way of excuse, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποφραδμοσύνη
div1.sense: suggestion, counsel, Hes.

div1.head: ὑποφρίσσω
div1.sense: to shudder slightly, Luc.

div1.head: ὑποφύω
div1.sense: to make to grow up, Il.

div1.head: ὑποφωλεύω
div1.sense: to lie hidden under, τινί Anth.

div1.head: ὑποφωνέω
div1.sense: to call out in answer, Plut.: to sing in answer, Mosch.

div1.head: ὑποχάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to give way gradually or a little, Il.

div1.head: ὑποχαλινίδιος
div1.sense: under the bridle:— ἡ ὑποχαλινιδία (sc. ἡνία) , a chin-strap attached to the bit, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπόχαλκος
div1.sense: containing a mixture of copper, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποχαράσσω
div1.sense: to engrave under, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποχαροπός
div1.sense: somewhat bright-eyed, Xen.

div1.head: ὑποχάσκω
div1.sense: to gape a little, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ὑποχείριος
div1.sense: under the hand, in hand, Od.
of persons, under any oneʼs hand, under command, subject, τινι Hdt., etc.; λαβεῖν τινα ὑποχείριον to get into oneʼs power, Eur.; ἔχειν τινὰ ὑπ. Thuc.

div1.head: ὑποχέω
div1.sense: to pour into a cup placed under, to pour out; of dry things, to strew or spread under, Hom.: Pass., φύλλα ὑποκεχυμένα ὑπὸ τοῖς ποσί leaves scattered under the feet, Hdt.:—metaph., ἀπιστίη ὑπεκέχυτο αὐτῷ distrust was poured secretly into him, i. e. stole over him, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑποχθόνιος
div1.sense: under the earth, subterranean, Hes., Eur., Anth.

div1.head: ὑποχλέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be rolled beneath, Il.

div1.head: ὑποχορηγέω
div1.sense: to supply, Strab.

div1.head: ὑποχορηγία
div1.sense: a supplying, succour, Strab.

div1.head: ὕποχος
div1.sense: subject, τινι Xen.; βασιλῆς βασιλέως ὕποχοι kingʼs subjects or officers, of the great king, Aesch.
= ἔνοχος, liable to, τινος Dem.

div1.head: ὑπόχρεως
div1.sense: indebted, in debt, Ar.; ὑπ. τινος his debtor, Plut.
of property, involved, Lat. obaeratus, Dem.
c. gen., ὑπ. φιλίας bound by ties of friendship, Plut.

div1.head: ὑποχρίω
div1.sense: to smear under or upon, τί τινι Hdt.; ὑπ. τινί to paint his face under the eyes, Xen.:—Mid., ὑποχρίεσθαι τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς to paint oneʼs own eyes underneath, Xen.

div1.head: ὑπόχρυσος
div1.sense: containing a mixture or proportion of gold: metaph. of persons, Plat.

div1.head: ὑποχωρέω
div1.sense: to go back, retire, recoil, Il., Thuc.; often in part., ὑποχωρήσας φεύγει Dem.
c. gen. to retire from a place, Hdt., Xen.; ὑπ. τινὶ τοῦ θρόνου to withdraw from oneʼs seat in honour of another, give it up to him, Ar.; and, ὑπ. τινι to give way to another, Thuc.
c. acc. to avoid, shun, Thuc., Plat.
to go on in succession, Pind.

div1.head: ὑποχώρημα
div1.sense: a downward evacuation, Theophr.

div1.head: ὑποχώρησις
div1.sense: a going back, retirement, retreat, Polyb.
a retiring-place, retreat, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπόψαμμος
div1.sense: having sand under, γῆ ὑποψαμμοτέρη somewhat sandy, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπόψαρος
div1.sense: somewhat dappled, ἵππος Strab.

div1.head: ὑποψία
div1.sense: suspicion, jealousy, ὑποψίην ἔχειν ἔς τινα Hdt., Attic; πρός τινα Dem.; ἐν ὑπ. ποιεῖσθαι Aeschin.
of the object, ἔχειν ὑπ. to admit of suspicion, Plat.; ὑπ. παρέχειν Thuc.

div1.head: ὑπόψιος
div1.sense: viewed from beneath the brows; ὑπόψιος ἄλλων viewed with suspicion among others, Il.

div1.head: ὑποψωνέω
div1.sense: to underbid in the purchase of victuals or to buy up underhand, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπτιάζω
div1.sense: to bend oneself back, to carry oneʼs head high, Aeschin.:—Pass., κάρα ὑπτιάζεται his head lies supine, Soph.

div1.head: ὑπτίασμα
div1.sense: that which is laid back, ὑπτιάσματα χερῶν supplication with hands upstretched, Lat. supinis manibus, Aesch.; ὑπτίασμα κειμένου πατρός his fatherʼs body as it lies supine, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑπτιασμός
div1.sense: a laying oneself backwards, Luc.

div1.head: ὑπτιαστέος
div1.sense: one must throw back, ἑαυτόν Xen.

div1.head: ὑπτιόω
div1.sense: Mid. Pass. to be turned on one's back, Aesch.

div1.head: ὕπτιος
div1.etym: from ὑπό, as Lat. supinus from sub
div1.sense: laid back, laid on oneʼs back, πέσεν ὕπτιος he fell backwards, opp. to πρηνής, Il.; of a quadruped, ὀρθοῦ ἑστεῶτος καὶ ὑπτίου rearing upright and falling backwards, Hdt.

generally with the under side uppermost, χείρ ὑπτία the hollow of the hand, Plut.; ἐξ ὑπτίου κράνους from the upturned helmet, with the hollow uppermost, Aesch.; so, παράθες ὑπτίαν (τὴν ἀσπίδα) Ar.; ἀψὶς ὑπτία a half-wheel with the concave side uppermost, Hdt.; ὑπτίοις σέλμασιν ναυτίλλεται he sails with the bottom uppermost, i. e. suffers shipwreck, Soph.; ἐξ ὑπτίας νεῖν to swim on the back (in metaph. sense), Plat.
of land, sloping evenly, of Egypt, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπωθέω
div1.sense: to push or thrust away, Il.

div1.head: ὑπωλένιος
div1.sense: under the elbow, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑπωμοσία
div1.sense: an oath taken to delay proceedings (v. ὑπόμνυμι II), an application for postponement of a trial, Dem.
an oath taken by the prosecutor in a γραφὴ παρανόμων (v. παράνομος 2), with the effect of suspending the proposed decree, Dem.

div1.head: ὑπωπιάζω
div1.sense: to strike one under the eye:—Pass. to have a black eye, ὑπωπιασμένος Ar.
metaph. to bruise, mortify, NTest.: also, to annoy greatly, wear out, NTest.

div1.head: ὑπώπιον
div1.sense: the part of the face under the eyes: generally the face, countenance, Il.
a blow in the face, a black eye, Ar.

div1.head: ὑπώρεια
div1.sense: the foot of a mountain, the skirts of a mountain range, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ὑπωρόφιος
div1.sense: under the roof, in the house, Il., Pind., Ar.

div1.head: ὑπώροφος
div1.sense: Eur.: of a swallowʼs nest, under the eaves, Anth.

div1.head: ὕπωχρος
div1.sense: pale yellow, sallow, Luc.

div1.head: ὕρχη
div1.sense: a jar, for pickles, Ar.

div1.head: ὕσγη
div1.sense: a shrub from which the dye ὕσγινον is derived.

div1.head: ὑσγινοβαφής
div1.sense: dyed scarlet, Xen., Luc.

div1.head: ὕσγινον
div1.sense: a dye from the shrub ὕσγη, scarlet, Anth.

div1.head: ὑσμίνη
div1.sense: a fight, battle, combat, Il.; metaplast. Epic dat. ὑσμῖνι as if from ὑσμίν or ὑσμίς, Il.

div1.head: ὗς
div1.sense: the wild swine, whether boar (hog) or sow, Hom., etc.; σῦς ἄγριος Il.; also σῦς κάπριος or κάπρος, v. sub vocc.
the domestic pig, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ὕσπληξ
div1.sense: a rope drawn across the racecourse, let down when the runners were to start, the starting-line, Plat., Anth.
the snare or gin of a birdcatcher, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑσσός
div1.sense: a javelin, the Roman pilum, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: ὕσσωπος
div1.sense: hyssop, prob. the caper-plant, NTest.

div1.head: ὑστάτιος
div1.etym: poetic for ὕστατος, as μεσσάτιος for μέσσος, Hom.
div1.sense: neut. as adv. at last, Il.

div1.head: ὑστεραῖος
div1.sense: on the day after, the next day (cf. προτεραῖος) ; τῇ ὑστεραίᾳ (Ionic -αίῃ) ἡμέρᾳ on the following day, next day, Lat. postridie, Hdt.; often without ἡμέρᾳ, Hdt., Attic; also, ἐς τὴν ὑστεραίην Hdt.; ἐν τῇ ὑστ. Plat.:—c. gen., τῇ ὑστεραίᾳ τῆς μάχης on the day after the battle, Plat.
= ὕστερος, later, subsequent, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ὑστέρα
div1.sense: the womb, mostly in pl. ὑστέραι, etc.

div1.head: ὑστερέω
div1.sense: to be behind or later, come late, Hdt., Attic

c. gen. rei, to come later than, come too late for, ὑστέρησαν ἡμέρῃ μιῇ τῆς συγκειμένης came one day after the appointed day, Hdt.; τῆς Μυτιλήνης ὑστερήκει had come too late to save Mytilene, Thuc.; ὑστ. τῆς πατρίδος to fail to assist it, Xen.
c. gen. pers. to come after him, Xen.; also c. dat. to come too late for him, Thuc.
metaph. to come short of, be inferior to, τινός Plat., etc.
to come short of, fail to obtain:—so in Mid., ὑστερεῖσθαί τινος NTest.
absol. to be in want, NTest.
of things, to fail, be wanting, Lat. deficere, NTest.

div1.head: ὑστέρημα
div1.sense: deficiency, need, want, NTest.

div1.head: ὑστερίζω
div1.sense: to come after, come later or too late, Thuc., Xen.
c. gen. rei, to come short of, come too late for, Dem.; to lag behind, Xen.
metaph. to come short of, be inferior to any one, c. gen., Xen.:—absol., ὑστ. τὸ εἰδέναι he falls short in knowledge, Xen.

div1.head: ὑστερόποινος
div1.sense: avenging after the act, late-avenging, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑστερόπους
div1.sense: coming late, Anth.

div1.head: ὕστερος
div1.sense: latter, last, comp. and Sup. without any Posit. adj. in use.
ὕστερος, η, ον latter,
of Place, latter, coming after, following, Eur., Xen.:—c. gen., ὕστεροι ἡμῶν behind us, Plat.; ὑστέρα νεώς behind (slower than) a ship, Aesch.
of Time, next, Il.; τῷ ὑστέρῳ ἔτει in the next year, Xen.; ὑστέρῳ χρόνῳ in after time, Aesch., etc.:—c. gen. pers. later than, after, Il., Plat.; also ὑστέρῳ χρόνῳ τούτων Hdt.
later, too late, Il., Soph.
c. gen. rei, too late for, Hdt., Ar.
as Subst. οἱ ὕστεροι Lat. posteri, Eur.
of inferiority in Age, Worth, or Quality, γένει ὕστερος, i. e. younger, Il.:— c. gen., οὐδενὸς ὕστ. second to none, Soph., Thuc.; ὕστερος τῶν νόμων below the laws, Aeschin.
neut. ὕστερον as adv. behind, c. gen., Xen.
of Time, later, afterwards, Hom., etc.; also ὕστερα Od.: —c. gen., ὕστερον τούτων later than these things, after them, Hdt.; πολλῷ ὕστ. τῶν Τρωικῶν Thuc.
in adv. sense with Preps., ἐς ὕστερον Od., Hdt., etc.: — ἐν ὑστέρῳ Thuc.:— ἐξ ὑστέρης Hdt.
ὕστατος, η, ον last,
of Place, πρῶτοί τε καὶ ὕστατοι Il.

of Time, τίνα πρῶτον, τίνα δʼ ὕστατον ἐξενάριξεν; Il.; πρὸς ὕστ. φῶς Aesch.: ἡ ὑστάτη (sc. ἡμέρα) τῆς ὁρτῆς the last day of the feast, Hdt.; οὐκ ἐν ὑστάτοις not among the last, Eur.; οἱ ὕστατοι εἰπόντες Dem., etc.:—c. gen., ὕστατος ἁλώσιος all too late for . . , Pind.
the neut. sg. and pl. as adv., πύματόν τε καὶ ὕστατον Od.; ὕστατα καὶ πύματα Il.; νῦν ὕστατα Il.; ὕστατα Hdt., etc.
in adv. sense with Preps., ἐν ὑστάτοις at last, Plat.

div1.head: ὑστεροφθόρος
div1.sense: late-destroying, Soph.

div1.head: ὑστερόφωνος
div1.sense: sounding after, echoing, Anth.

div1.head: ὕστριξ
div1.sense: the porcupine, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑστριχίς
div1.sense: a whip for punishing slaves, Ar.

div1.head: ὕφαιμος
div1.sense: suffused with blood, blood-shot, Dem.
of temperament, sanguine, Plat.

div1.head: ὑφαίνω
div1.sense: to weave, ἱστὸν ὑφαίνειν to weave a web, Hom.; ἱμάτιον Plat., etc.:—absol. to weave, ply the loom, Hdt.:—Mid., ἱμάτιον ὑφαίνεσθαι to weave oneself a cloak, Plat.
to contrive, plan, invent, Lat. texere, δόλον ὑφαίνειν Il.; μῆτιν ὑφ. Od.
generally, to create, construct, Pind.

div1.head: ὑφαίρεσις
div1.sense: a taking away from under, a purloining, ap. Dem.

div1.head: ὑφαιρέω
div1.sense: to seize underneath or inwardly, Hom.
to draw or take away from under a thing, c. gen., Il., Plat.:—also τὴν χεῖρα ὑφῄρει tried to draw it away, Ar.

to take away underhand, filch away, Thuc.; ὑφ. τῆς ὑποψίας gradually to take away part of . . , Thuc.:—Pass., ὑπαραιρημένος (Ionic perf. part.) put secretly away, made away with, Hdt.:—so in Mid. to take away underhand, filch away, purloin, Hdt., Ar., etc.
in Mid. also c. acc. pers., ὑφ. τινά τινος to rob him of a thing, Aeschin.

div1.head: ὕφαλος
div1.sense: under the sea, ὕφ. Ἔρεβος the darkness of the deep, Soph.; τὸ ὕφαλον the lower waters, Strab.

div1.head: ὑφάντης
div1.sense: a weaver, Plat.

div1.head: ὑφαντικός
div1.sense: skilled in weaving, Plat.: adv. -κῶς, in weaver-like fashion, Plat.
ἡ ὑφαντική (sc. τέχνη) , the art of weaving, Plat.

div1.head: ὑφαντοδόνητος
div1.sense: woven by the flight of the shuttle, Ar.

div1.head: ὑφαντός
div1.sense: woven, Od., Trag.; ὅσα ὑφαντά τε καὶ λεῖα brocaded and plain stuffs, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑφάπτω
div1.sense: to set on fire from underneath, Hdt., Eur., etc.
metaph. to inflame unperceived, Xen.

div1.head: ὑφαρπάζω
div1.sense: to snatch away from under, Xen.
to take away underhand, filch away, Lat. surripere, Ar.
ὑφ. λόγον to snatch away a word just when one is going to speak it, take the word out of oneʼs mouth, Hdt.: to snap up, Ar.

div1.head: ὕφασμα
div1.sense: a woven robe, web, Od.

div1.head: ὑφειμένως
div1.sense: remissly, less violently, Lat. submisse, Xen.

div1.head: ὑφεῖσα
div1.sense: I placed under or secretly, ὑπείσας ἄνδρας having set them in ambush, Hdt.

div1.head: ὑφεκτέος
div1.sense: one must submit to, Plat.

div1.head: ὑφελκτέος
div1.sense: one must draw away, τῶν δᾳδίων some of the torches, Ar.

div1.head: ὑφέλκω
div1.sense: to draw away gently, ὑφ. τινὰ ποδοῖιν to draw one away by the two feet, Il.: — to draw away by undermining, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑφέρπω
div1.sense: to creep on secretly, Lat. subrepere, ὑφεῖρπε γὰρ πολύ the report was spreading far, Soph.
like ὑπέρχομαι II, of involuntary feelings, to steal upon, come over, Lat. subire animum, χαρά μʼ ὑφέρπει, τρόμος μʼ ὑφ. Aesch.

div1.head: ὑφηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to go just before, to guide, lead, τινι Eur., Plat., etc.:— absol. to go first, lead the way, Soph., Thuc., Plat.; κατὰ τὸν ὑφηγημένον τρόπον according to the normal plan, Arist.
c. acc. cogn., ὑφ. τὴν ὁδόν to shew the way, Plut.
c. acc. rei, to shew the way to, instruct in, Xen., Plat.
to lead to a thing, indicate that it is so, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑφήγησις
div1.sense: a guiding, guidance, Dem.

div1.head: ὑφηγητής
div1.sense: one who leads the way, a guide, leader, Soph.; ὡς ὑφηγητοῦ τινος (sc. ὄντος) as if led by some (invisible) guide, Soph.
a teacher, master, Plut.

div1.head: ὑφηνιοχέω
div1.sense: to be a ὑφηνίοχος, Luc.:—Pass. to drive after or behind, of chariots, Dem.

div1.head: ὑφηνίοχος
div1.sense: the charioteer, as subordinate to the warrior in his chariot, Il.

div1.head: ὑφή
div1.sense: a web, in pl., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ὑφήσσων
div1.sense: somewhat less or smaller, Hes.

div1.head: ὑφιζάνω
div1.sense: to crouch beneath, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: ὑφίζησις
div1.sense: a settling or sinking, Strab.

div1.head: ὑφίζω
div1.sense: to sit down, crouch, Eur.

div1.head: ὑφίημι
div1.sense: to let down, ὑφ. ἱστόν to lower the mast, Il.; ὑφ. ἱστία, Lat. submittere vela, Hhymn.
to put under, τί τινι Hom.; τι ὑπό τι Xen.:— to put a young one under its dam, put it to suck, Od., Theocr.; in Mid., of the mother, ὑφίεσθαι μαστοῖς to put it to her breast, to suckle it, Eur.
ὑφ. τινά to engage any one secretly, to prepare him to play a part, to suborn, Soph.: Pass., ὡς ἔχιδνʼ ὑφειμένη like a snake secretly introduced, slipped in, Soph.
to give up, surrender, Xen.

intr. to slacken, relax or abate from a thing, c. gen., ὑπεὶς τῆς ὀργῆς Hdt.; absol. to give in, abate, οὐδὲν ὑπιέντες Hdt.:—so too in Mid., Hdt.; so of things, τὸ ὕδωρ ὑπίεται τοῦ ψυχροῦ abates from its chill, Hdt.; τοῦ στόματός γε ὑφ. I give way as to it, Xen.; c. dat. to yield, give way to any one, τοῖς πολεμίοις Xen.
in Mid. and Pass. to lower oneʼs sails, Ar.; mostly in part. perf., πλεῖν ὑφειμένῃ δοκεῖ μοι methinks I should run with lowered sails, i. e. to lower my tone, Soph.
σώζω νεοσσοὺς ὄρνις ὣς ὑφειμένη, like a cowering hen, —or perhaps with my nestlings under me, Eur.
generally, to submit, Xen.; c. inf., κατθανεῖν ὑφειμένη submissively prepared to die, Eur.

div1.head: ὑφικάνω
div1.sense: to steal over one, Il.

div1.head: ὑφίστημι
div1.sense: in these tenses Causal, to place or set under, τί τινι Hdt., Pind.; τρεῖς σταυροὺς ὑπίστησι plants three piles in the lake to support a house, Hdt.:—metaph., γνώμας ὑποστήσας σοφάς having laid them as a foundation, Soph.
to post secretly or in ambush, Hdt., Xen.
Causal also in fut. and aor1 mid. to substitute, τί τινι one thing for another, Xen.
Pass., with aor2 act. ὑπ-έστην, perf. ὑφ-έστηκα, Ionic part. ὑπ-εστεώς:— to stand under as a support, c. dat., Hdt.
to sink to the bottom, settle, τὸ ὑφιστάμενον the milk, opp. to τὸ ἐφιστάμενον (the cream), Hdt.

to place oneself under an engagement, engage or promise to do, c. inf. fut., ὅσσʼ Ἀχιλῆι ὑπέστημεν δώσειν Il., etc.; c. inf. aor., οὔ τίς με ὑπέστη σαῶσαι Il.; c. inf. pres., Hdt.:—absol., after promise given, Od.; ὥσπερ ὑπέστη as he promised, Thuc.:—when foll. by acc., an inf. may be supplied, τρίποδας οὕς οἱ ὑπέστη (sc. δώσειν) Il.; ἐκτελέουσιν ὑπόσχεσιν ἥνπερ ὑπέσταν Il.
to submit to any one, τινι Il.

c. acc. rei, to submit to, consent to, ὁ τὸ ἐλάχιστον ὑπιστάμενος who offers to take the least, Hdt.; ὑφ. τὸν πλοῦν to undertake it unwillingly, Thuc.; so, ὑφ. τὸν κίνδυνον Thuc.: —rarely c. dat., ὑφ. ξυμφοραῖς ταῖς μεγίσταις Thuc.
to undertake an office, Xen.
to lie concealed or in ambush, Hdt., Eur., etc.
to support an attack, to resist, withstand, c. dat., Aesch.; c. acc., Eur., Thuc.:—absol. to stand oneʼs ground, face the enemy, Lat. subsistere, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ὑφοράω
div1.sense: to look at from below, view with suspicion or jealousy, suspect, τινά Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ὑφορμέω
div1.sense: to lie secretly at anchor, Polyb.

div1.head: ὑφορμίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. and Mid., to come to anchor secretly or under a place, Thuc., Plut.

div1.head: ὕφορμος
div1.sense: an anchorage, Strab.

div1.head: ὕφυδρος
div1.sense: under water, of a diver, Thuc.

div1.head: ὑψαγόρας
div1.sense: a big talker, boaster, braggart, Od.

div1.head: ὑψαυχενίζω
div1.sense: to carry the neck high, shew off, Anth.

div1.head: ὑψαύχην
div1.sense: carrying the neck high, ἵππος Plat.:—metaph. stately, towering, Eur.

div1.head: ὑψερεφής
div1.sense: high-roofed, high-vaulted, Hom., Ar.

div1.head: ὑψήγορος
div1.sense: talking big, grandiloquent, vaunting, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑψηλαυχενία
div1.sense: a carrying the neck high, Xen.

div1.head: ὑψηλόκρημνος
div1.sense: with lofty cliffs, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑψηλολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to talk high, speak proudly, Plat.

div1.head: ὑψηλόνοος
div1.sense: high-minded: τὸ ὑψηλόνουν Plat.

div1.head: ὑψηλός
div1.sense: high, lofty, high-raised, Lat. altus, sublimis, Hom., Hdt., Trag., etc.; of a highland country, χώρη ὀρεινὴ καὶ ὑψηλή Hdt.; ὑψηλὰ χωρία Thuc.
metaph. high, lofty, stately, Pind., Plat.; ὑψηλὰ κομπεῖν to talk loftily, Soph.; πνεῦμα ὑψηλὸν αἴρειν Eur.

div1.head: ὑψηλοφρονέω
div1.sense: to be high-minded, NTest.

div1.head: ὑψηλόφρων
div1.sense: high-minded, high-spirited, haughty, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ὑψηχής
div1.sense: high-sounding, ἵπποι ὑψηχέες loud-neighing, Il.

div1.head: ὑψίβατος
div1.sense: set on high, high-placed, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: ὑψιβόας
div1.sense: loud-shouter, name of a frog, Batr.

div1.head: ὑψιβρεμέτης
div1.sense: high-thundering, Hom.

div1.head: ὑψιγέννητος
div1.sense: born on high, ἐλαίας ὑψιγέννητος κλάδος its topmost shoot, Aesch.

div1.head: ὑψίγυιος
div1.sense: with high limbs, high-stemmed, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψίζυγος
div1.sense: of a rower, sitting high on the benches; of Zeus, high-throned, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ὑψίθρονος
div1.sense: high-throned, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψικάρηνος
div1.sense: high-topped, Hhymn.

div1.head: ὑψικέλευθος
div1.sense: wandering on high, Anth.

div1.head: ὑψίκερως
div1.sense: high-horned, Od., Soph.: —also metapl. acc. ἱψικέρᾱτα πέτραν a high-peaked rock, Pind. ap. Ar.

div1.head: ὑψίκομος
div1.sense: with lofty foliage, towering, Hom., Hes., Eur.

div1.head: ὑψίκομπος
div1.sense: high boasting, arrogant: adv., Soph.

div1.head: ὑψίκρημνος
div1.sense: with high crags, of a mountain, Hom. Epigram.
of towns, built on a high crag, Aesch.

div1.head: υ
div1.sense: Υ, υ, ὐψιλόντό, indecl., twentieth letter of Gr. alphabet: as numeral υʹ 400, but ͵υ 400, 000. Called ὑψιλόν, because the orig. sound was broad, like ου, and afterwards was thin like French u. The Gr. υ, like Lat. v, was originally both a vowel (u) and a semi-vowel (v), v. infr. II.
Interchanges of υ with other vowels,
Aeolic for ο, as ὄνυμα στύμα ὔρνις for ὄνομα στόμα ὄρνις; also πίσυρες for πέτορες (τέσσαρες) , cf. νύξ, Lat. nox.
Aeolic, the diphth. ου became οι, Μοῖσα for Μοῦσα, λέγοισα for λέγουσα.
ῡ sometimes replaces οι, as κοινός ξυνός, κοίρανος κύριος.
Boeot. ῡ for ω, as χελύνη for χελώνη.

υ as a semivowel represented vau (v) , the digamma, sometimes it formed the diphth. αυ, as αὐέρυσαν for ἀνϝέρυσαν (v. αὐερύω) , αὐίαχοι for ἀνϝίαχοι, αὐάτα for αϝάτα (ἄτη) , καλαῦροψ for καλάϝροψ, ταλαύρινος for ταλάϝρινος, ταναύποδες for ταναϝόποδες; sometimes the dipth. ευ, as εὔαδεν for ἔϝαδεν.

div1.head: ὑψίλοφος
div1.sense: high-crested, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψιμέδων
div1.sense: ruling on high, Hes., Ar.
metaph. towering, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψιμέλαθρος
div1.sense: high-built, Hhymn.

div1.head: ὑψινεφής
div1.sense: dwelling high in the clouds, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψιπαγής
div1.sense: high-built, towering, Anth.

div1.head: ὕψι
div1.sense: on high, aloft, Hom.: on the high sea, out at sea, Od.

div1.head: ὑψίπεδος
div1.sense: with high ground, high-placed, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψιπέτηλος
div1.sense: with high foliage, towering, Hom.

div1.head: ὑψιπέτης
div1.sense: high-flying, soaring, Hom., Ar.: generally lofty, Eur.

div1.head: ὑψίπολις
div1.sense: high or honoured in oneʼs city, Soph.

div1.head: ὑψίπους
div1.sense: high-footed, i. e. high-reared, lofty, Soph.

div1.head: ὑψίπρυμνος
div1.sense: with high stern, Strab.

div1.head: ὑψίπρῳρος
div1.sense: with high prow, Strab.

div1.head: ὑψίπυλος
div1.sense: with high gates, Il., Eur.

div1.head: ὑψίπυργος
div1.sense: high-towered, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ὕψιστος
div1.etym: Sup. without any Posit. in use
div1.sense: highest, loftiest, Aesch., Soph., etc.; ἐν τοῖς ὑψίστοις, i. e. in heaven above, NTest.

div1.head: ὑψίτερος
div1.sense: loftier, Theocr.

div1.head: ὑψιφαής
div1.sense: high-shining, far-seen, Anth.

div1.head: ὑψίφρων
div1.sense: high-minded, haughty, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψιχαίτης
div1.sense: long-haired, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψόθεν
div1.sense: from on high, from aloft, from above, Lat. desuper, Il., Hes.
like ὑψοῦ, high, aloft, on high, Anth.
c. gen. above, over, Pind.

div1.head: ὑψόθι
div1.sense: aloft, on high, Il.

div1.head: ὑψόροφος
div1.sense: high-roofed, high-ceiled, Hom.

div1.head: ὑψόσε
div1.sense: aloft, on high, up high, Hom.; ὑψόσʼ ἔχοντες high reaching, Il.

div1.head: ὕψος
div1.sense: height, Hdt., Attic; ὕ. ἔχειν, λαμβάνειν to rise to some height, Thuc.:—absol. ὕψος, in height, opp. to μῆκος or εὖρος, Hdt.
metaph. the top, summit, crown, Plat.

div1.head: ὑψοῦ
div1.sense: aloft, on high, Hom.; τῆς πόλιος ἐκκεχωσμένης ὑψοῦ having the soil raised to a great height, Hdt.:—metaph., ὑψοῦ ἐξᾶραί τι to praise it highly, Hdt.; ὑψοῦ αἴρειν θυμόν Soph.

div1.head: ὑψόω
div1.sense: to lift high, raise up, Batr., Anth.: Mid. to raise for oneself, Anth.
metaph. to elevate, exalt, NTest.

div1.head: ὕω
div1.sense: to send rain, to rain, Ζεὺς ὗε Hom., etc.; ὁ θεὸς ὕει Hdt.:—then, the nom. being omitted, ὕει used impers., Lat. pluit, it rains, Hes., Hdt.; ὕοντος when it is raining, Ar.; ὕοντος πολλῷ as it was raining heavily, Xen.

c. acc. loci, ἑπτὰ ἐτέων οὐκ ὗε τὴν Θήρην for seven years it did not rain on Thera, Hdt.:—hence in Pass., with fut. mid. to be rained on, Od.; ὕσθησαν αἱ Θῆβαι Thebes was rained upon, i. e. it rained there, Hdt.; ἡ χώρη ὕεται, i. e. it rains in the country, Hdt.
c. acc. cogn., ὗσε χρυσόν it rained gold, Pind.; καινὸν ἀεὶ Ζεὺς ὕει ὕδωρ Ar.
